item.title: Office Co-ordinator
item.description:
JOB SUMMARY:

The Administrative Clerk provides clerical and reception support for the administrative staff of the staffing agency, including answering telephones, greeting clients, applicants and visitors, making appointments and referrals, typing, and filing.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

  1. Greets and refers clients and visitors.
  2. Answers main telephone system, makes referrals, takes messages, and directs incoming calls appropriately.
  3. Receives and logs incoming mail.
  4. Types and/or reproduces reports, forms, correspondence, checks, grants, and other material as generated by agency staff.Proofreads all work for accuracy and neatness.
  5. Duplicates, collates, and prepares for mailing agency reports, lists, correspondence, grants, etc.
  6. Maintains agency copy machine.

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

May perform other duties as deemed necessary by supervisor.\

Managing staffing procedure for recruitment.
item.job:requirements:
JOB QUALIFICATIONS:

  1. Ability to accurately type a minimum of 50 wpm.
  2. Good working knowledge of English, grammar, punctuation, spelling, style, etc.
  3. Ability to operate standard office machines.
  4. Knowledge of efficient office procedures.
  5. Ability to answer telephones and greet the public in a friendly and courteous manner.
  6. Ability to speak in a clear and understandable manner and write legibly.
  7. Bilingual (English-Spanish-Hindi) speaking and writing skills preferred.
  8. High school graduate or equivalent.
  9. One (1) year of clerical and staffing work experience.
  10. Microsoft WORD & Excel moderate knowledge required.

item.title: Warehouse Workers- Princeton NJ
item.description:
We are seeking energetic, motivated and reliable Warehouse Workers for immediate openings on 1st, 2nd and 3rd shifts. You will be responsible for providing warehouse support including: picking, packing, assembly, sorting, shipping and receiving of orders to meet the facility's productivity and quality demands.

Warehouse Worker - Warehouse General Labor - Laborer - Production - Shipping and Receiving – Processors – Equipment Operators, Material Handler, and Line Leaders

Job Responsibilities:

We are looking for employees with positive attitudes that can handle multiple projects simultaneously. As a Warehouse Worker, you will work in a manufacturing and production environment. Your duties will include pulling, packing and sorting items for shipping and receiving.

Other Responsibilities of this role include:

  • Organizing the work area and keeping it clean
  • Using a hand held radio frequency computer system
  • Packing materials for shipment
  • Lifting up to 50 lbs on a regular basis
  • Standing for extended periods of time
item.job:requirements:
As a Warehouse Worker, you must be able to work in a team-oriented environment.  You must be able to communicate well with management and fellow employees.  Ideal candidates will have a positive attitude and previous warehouse experience.

Other requirements include:

  • High school diploma
  • 6 month - 1 year of previous work experience in a warehouse
  • Must be willing to submit to drug screen and background checks
  • Needs to be able to work 40 plus hours per week, some overtime may be required
  • Ability to lift 50 lbs
  • Ability to provide 3 positive work references.

item.title: Forklift Driver
item.description:
AtWork is seeking a certified Forklift Driver for our client in the McClellan Park area for immediate hire!

Responsibilities:

  • Prepare products and materials for shipment; load/unload, and stage products and materials
  • Ensure daily forklift inspections
  • Responsible for moving pallets, products, and/or boxes in the warehouse
  • Track and record units of materials handled with proper documentation
  • Ensure load sheets are documented accurately
  • Maintain a clean and orderly warehouse environment
  • Adhere to all safety policies and procedures

Qualifications:

  • Must have minimum 6 months of forklift experience
  • Must have forklift certification, or be able to pass a forklift certification test upon hire
  • Must be able to lift 50-100 lbs throughout the day
  • Must be able to meet requirements of background screening and drug screening for employment purposes

FORKLIFT DRIVER SHIFT IS M-F, 8:00 AM - 4:30 PM PAYING $14-$15/HOUR

Email resume or call us at 916-791-3000 for immediate consideration.

item.title: CDL Driver - Dayton
item.description:
Job Responsibilities:

Our client is looking for 1-2 years of Experienced CDL Drivers as an employee with positive attitudes that can handle multiple projects simultaneously.

As a Commercial Driver, you will work in a manufacturing and production environment. Your duties will include Driving, Distributing, Port Work and sorting items for shipping and receiving. Able

Other Responsibilities of this role include:

  • You will be responsible for distribute different products in New Jersey area.
  • Able to manage live loads or drop and hook
  • Average drive up to 1500+ miles weekly
  • Have at least two (2) years of verifiable truck-driving experience.
  • Must cooperate with Supervisor / Manager
  • Driving for extended periods of time
item.job:requirements:
JOB REQUIREMENTS

As a Commercial Driver, you must be able to work in a team-oriented environment.  You must be able to communicate well with management and fellow employees.  Ideal candidates will have a positive attitude and previous commercial driving work experience.

The equipment that the employee must be able to master will be predominately a twin screw tractor with a number of trailer options, ranging from 20' container chassis to a 53' road trailer. Some of daily work load will be deliveries and/or pick up of containers from the ports or designated warehouse facilities.

Drivers must responsible for their cargo through bill of landing or delivery orders to verify quantity counts.

drivers must handles multiple orders and move pallets using hand jacks .

Other requirements include:

  • Possession of both Sealink card and TWIC Card is mandatory.
  • High school diploma
  • Clean MVR and no felony or misdemeanor convictions
  • Must be willing to submit to drug screen and background checks
  • Needs to be able to work 40 plus hours per week, some overtime may be required
  • Ability to provide 3 positive work references
item.job:additionalinfo:
Benefits

Our client will provide benefits of the Commercial Driver role includes:

  • After one year's employment increment on hourly wages
  • Medical, dental and limited vision benefits after 90 days
  • Life Insurance
  • 401K after 90 days
  • Direct Deposit

Call Us ASAP at 609-454-6786 or Apply online at www.njatwork.com

DAYS: SATURDAY AND SUNDAY ONLY

  • Safely operates mixers, ovens, choppers, shredders, steamers, grills, grinders, steam kettles, fry kettles and other food service related equipment when directed.Carries tools and equipment to and from storage and working areas.
  • Assists in preliminary preparation of meals and in meal preparation as directed.
  • Cleans tables, washes dishes, and performs other general and assigned cleaning tasks.
  • Assists in other food operations as needed.

Requirements:

Prior work or cooking experience desired but not required, however employee must rapidly become familiar with and practice proper food handling, sanitation, safety precautions, and personal hygiene, as well as the care and use of a variety of kitchen utensils and equipment. Poor habits in any of these areas will likely lead to refusal to hire or immediate dismissal.

item.title: Inventory Planner/ Material Planner
item.description:
Summary: This position will be responsible for analyzing inventory levels and inventory requirements, coordinating all material planning efforts with multiple departments, and for the purchase of products in accordance with established company procedures.  The Material Planner is responsible for maintaining adequate inventory to fulfill sales requirements while increasing inventory turnover and reducing scrap.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities (other duties may be assigned):

  • Analyze current component inventory and future component inventory against actual sales, forecasted sales plan, and previous product sales trends to identify inventory needs
    • Procure all required materials from approved suppliers as required by the inventory analysis.
    • Manage purchase orders to demand requirements and communicate changes to suppliers
    • Expedite purchase orders as necessary.  Identify actual and potential delivery problems and take proactive steps.
    • Track progress of parts to ensure time schedules and delivery.
    • Analyze and apply MRP reports in ordering parts to ensure appropriate delivery dates
  • Plan assembly schedule to convert component inventory into finished products in accordance with actual and forecasted sales
    • Plan work orders for product lines within capacity schedule
    • Monitor the movement of materials through the production cycle.
    • Expedite operations that delay schedules and alters schedules to meet unforeseen conditions
    • Works with master scheduler to meet shipping dates according to sales forecasts and/or customer orders.
  • Analyze supply chain procedures and establish strategies to improve short and long term accuracy, efficiency, and cost
    • Verify data accuracy (part numbers, BOMs, part costs) in MRP and resolve discrepancies
    • Identify problem areas with the supply chain, research root causes, and offer possible solutions
    • Create and analyze reports, graphs and charts for various logistical related functions
    • Create and implement improvement plans to reduce inventory and non-value added work
    • Maintain knowledge and understanding of the latest materials and procurement concepts
    • Complete special assignments for the department as directed by the Manager
item.job:requirements:
• Required Skills
    • Excellent Organizational Skills
    • Superior Attention to Detail
    • Advanced Excel Skills
    • Data Analysis Ability
  • Must be able to manage time, work independently, solve problems, function well under pressure, meet deadlines, and handle multiple projects simultaneously
  • Previous work experience in Data Analysis, Business Analysis, Accounting, Payroll or Bookkeeping is a plus
item.job:additionalinfo:
- Hours of operation are from 8am- 4:30pm (30 minutes lunch) 
- Some Overtime and Some Saturdays required
- Inventory Clerk (95% in office , 5% warehouse inventory)

item.title: Accounting Assistant Dayton, NJ
item.description:
JOB SUMMARY:

his is a responsible non supervisory position. Duties include performing a variety of clerical and entry-level bookkeeping and accounting tasks, applying accepted procedures to the preparation and maintenance of accounting and other records, and preparing financial, statistical, and/or technical reports.

Office Hours : 9:00 AM - 5:30 PM
item.job:requirements:
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

  1. Prepares, proofs, and types payrolls and other financial reports; makes routine cost distributions; posts subject accounts.
  1. Prepares and posts accounting documents, such as fees, receipts, invoices, requisitions, vouchers, expense accounts, and related operating reports.
  2. Files and maintains clerical records and reports pertinent information to accounting and bookkeeping or technical operations.Prepares and mails bills or statements, or prepares lists of outstanding bills payable.

 

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

 

  1. May perform secretarial functions as needed for assigned staff member(s).
  2. Performs such other duties as may be assigned.
  3. Assists in balancing accounts by running tapes, proofreading, etc.; prepares summary of balances, cost information, or other reports as requested for supervisor’s use in preparing financial statements.
  4. May proofread and post operations progress or other reports and make a monthly summary or recaps of such reports as needed.
  5. May audit and proof accounting or other reports for clerical accuracy and conformance to departmental, county, and state procedures.

 KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES: 

  1. Working knowledge of Microsoft applications - Quick Book, Word, Excel, Power Point, ,  bookkeeping theories and practices and accepted office procedures.
  2. May require the ability to type at a speed of at least 40 words per minute with a high degree of accuracy.

 TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE: 

  1. High school graduation or its equivalent, including courses in bookkeeping.
  2. At least one (1) years’ experience in bookkeeping, accounting, or secretarial assignments involving advanced recordkeeping (directly related business school or college courses may be substituted equally for up to six (6) months’ experience); OR
  3. Any equivalent combination of experience and training that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.

item.title: Senior Marketing Manager- Pharmaceutical- Over The Counter Experience
item.description:
Looking for a Senior Marketing Manager, a leading pharmaceutical company. Immediately joining.

 The position plays a key leadership role within the Company. This individual will have a pivotal role in maximizing the market share and improving the profitability of the division. This position reports into the Executive Vice President and will be based in Dayton, New Jersey.

Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited, to the following:

  • Developing the long and short terms strategy for maximizing growth
  • Assess each product family needs and identify gaps through gap analysis to maximize market share
  • Deep dive into therapeutic category to identify opportunity areas
  • Managing the commercial evaluation and planning of new product launches via internal development and/or corporate development, including collaboration and integration with R&D, project management, marketing, business development, IP/legal and finance teams
  • Identify and develop potential business opportunities
  • Identifying new areas for market penetration and growth opportunities for the company
  • Develop market share and product revenue forecasts
  • Provide business analytics and rolling forecasts to supply chain
  • Develop pre-launch, launch or annual marketing strategies
  • Develop, execute and manage all marketing programs from concept to implementation
  • Develop, manage and monitor all marketing budgets
  • Supports business unit and sales management in the execution of strategy for specific opportunities and presentations to potential clients
  • Analyze and report sales data in order to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement
  • Responsible for portfolio management of all products
  • Project Management for key internal projects
  • Coordinating with India teams for manufacturing and R&D
  • Support pricing and business models with support function to ensure optimization of profitability through robust pricing system
  • Label control and design for all store brand and control brand products
  • Work with Art Projects team to oversee all package development

Qualification & Experience

  • Over the Counter ( OTC) related Pharma sphere
  • OTC or Private Label Experience is must
  • Undergraduate degree is required
  • Master in business or marketing specialization preferred
  • A minimum of 8-10 years of progressive experience in executing in a similar business environment, preferably with a breadth of functional and/or industry experience is required
  • Experience using syndicated data and marketing tools is required
  • Demonstrated track record of people development people management is preferred

item.title: Senior Marketing Manager- OTC Pharmaceutical
item.description:
Looking for a Senior Marketing Manager, a leading pharmaceutical company. Immediately joining.

 The position plays a key leadership role within the Company. This individual will have a pivotal role in maximizing the market share and improving the profitability of the division. This position reports into the Executive Vice President and will be based in Dayton, New Jersey.

Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited, to the following:

  • Developing the long and short terms strategy for maximizing growth
  • Assess each product family needs and identify gaps through gap analysis to maximize market share
  • Deep dive into therapeutic category to identify opportunity areas
  • Managing the commercial evaluation and planning of new product launches via internal development and/or corporate development, including collaboration and integration with R&D, project management, marketing, business development, IP/legal and finance teams
  • Identify and develop potential business opportunities
  • Identifying new areas for market penetration and growth opportunities for the company
  • Develop market share and product revenue forecasts
  • Provide business analytics and rolling forecasts to supply chain
  • Develop pre-launch, launch or annual marketing strategies
  • Develop, execute and manage all marketing programs from concept to implementation
  • Develop, manage and monitor all marketing budgets
  • Supports business unit and sales management in the execution of strategy for specific opportunities and presentations to potential clients
  • Analyze and report sales data in order to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement
  • Responsible for portfolio management of all products
  • Project Management for key internal projects
  • Coordinating with India teams for manufacturing and R&D
  • Support pricing and business models with support function to ensure optimization of profitability through robust pricing system
  • Label control and design for all store brand and control brand products
  • Work with Art Projects team to oversee all package development

Qualification & Experience

  • Over the Counter ( OTC) related Pharma sphere
  • OTC or Private Label Experience is must
  • Undergraduate degree is required
  • Master in business or marketing specialization preferred
  • A minimum of 8-10 years of progressive experience in executing in a similar business environment, preferably with a breadth of functional and/or industry experience is required
  • Experience using syndicated data and marketing tools is required
  • Demonstrated track record of people development people management is preferred

item.description:
Immediate openings for energetic, motivated, and reliable, Fluent in SPANISH AND ENGLISH Warehouse Workers for 1st shift. Location - DAYTON, NJ.

TIME : 8:00 AM - 4:30 PM

Looking for Warehouse

Common responsibilities include: forklift operation, picking, packing, assembly, sorting, shipping and receiving of orders to meet the facility's productivity and quality demands. Do you like overtime pay?  This is a very busy facility and 40+ hours a week is a possibility.

Warehouse Worker - Warehouse General Labor - Laborer - (loading and unloading) - Shipping and Receiving, Forklift Operation, and extensive warehouse experience is preferable.

 

Job Responsibilities:

We are looking for employees with positive attitudes that can handle multiple projects simultaneously. As a Warehouse Worker, you will work in a manufacturing and production environment. Your duties can include  any of the following:  driving forklift, pulling, packing and sorting items for shipping and receiving.

 

Other Responsibilities of this role include:

  • Organizing the work area and keeping it clean
  • Using a hand held radio frequency computer system
  • Packing materials for shipment
  • Lifting up to 50 lbs on a regular basis
  • Standing for extended periods of time

item.title: Custodial/ Janitor/ Cleaner
item.description:
Perform various custodial duties to include daily cleaning of restrooms, lounges and corridors in accordance with standard operating procedures of the department.

Qualifications

  • Ability to stand, climb, bend, stoop and crouch for extended periods of time.
  • Must be able to initiate and maintain good customer and co-worker relationships in a team environment.
  • Ability to follow oral instructions and directions.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Performs cleaning functions in assigned areas following established schedules using the prescribed methods.
  • Dust horizontal/vertical surfaces.
  • Empty and remove waste or recycles trash receptacles.
  • Dry and wet mop floors.
  • Spot clean walls, windows and metal surfaces.-Replenish restroom supplies.
  • Assist in cleaning of spills.
  • Maintain assigned equipment for cleanliness and report all repairs needed.
  • In case of emergency, perform duties as assigned.
  • Complete all other assigned tasks by management in which the employee is capable of performing.
  • Scrub floors to remove all soil and floor finish from base floor.-Refinish floors to a clean and glossy appearance.
  • Spot clean carpets.

 

Hours:

Monday - Sunday : 10:00 AM - 6:30 PM

Job Type: Temp

Salary: $11/hour

item.title: PHARMACIST
item.description:
One of our client is looking for experienced 2 Pharmacists, in Bronx and other locations, NY area.

Job brief

As a pharmacist you will be responsible for preparing and administering appropriate pharmaceuticals to patients. You will achieve this either by executing a physician’s order or by addressing the patient’s problems and needs.

The job involves a high level of responsibility and knowledge. A pharmacist does not merely hand out prescribed medicine; he/she has the expertise and willingness to assist people and provide them with information and solutions.

The pharmacist must be fully qualified to interpret symptoms so that the patient can either be given immediate treatment for a trifling condition or to be referred to the suitable doctor. Pharmacists must also be able to provide professional advice on cosmetics or para pharmaceuticals.

The goal is to ensure effective medication use and become the people’s trusted ally against health issues. That way you can deliver maximum value to both the pharmacy and society.

Responsibilities

  • Organize the pharmacy in an efficient manner to make the identification of products easier and faster
  • Maintain full control over delivering, stocking and labeling medicine and other products and monitor their condition to prevent expiring or deterioration
  • Review and execute physician’s prescriptions checking their appropriateness and legality
  • Listen carefully to customers to interpret their needs and issues and offer information and advice
  • Provide assistance other medical services such as injections, blood pressure/ temperature measurements etc.
  • Prepare medicine when appropriate using correct dosages and material for each individual patient
  • Keep records of patient history and of all activities regarding heavy medication
  • Keep abreast of advancements in medicine by attending conferences and seminars and collaborating with other healthcare professionals
  • Comply with all applicable legal rules, regulations and procedures

Requirements

  • Valid NY state Pharmacy license to practice the profession.
  • NPR is required.
  • Knowledge of Micro Merchant Software.
  • Proven experience as a pharmacist.
  • 2 to 5 years of experience.
  • Thorough understanding of dosage administration and measurement, chemical compounds, medical brands etc.
  • Outstanding knowledge of MS Office and Pharmacy information systems (. Micro-merchant)
  • Good organizing skills and Must be professional and have excellent attention to detail to prevent errors. 
  • Excellent communication skills with a customer oriented approach
  • Integrity and compassion
  • Degree in Pharmacy
  • Bilingual proficiency would be plus
  • Must be flexible to work overtime, other shifts, possible weekends/holidays. 

Please call us at 609.454.6786 for more information

ATWork Personnel Services 3535 Quakerbridge Rd, Suite 102, Hamilton, NJ 08619 Ph: (609) 454 - 6786 |Fax: (609) 423 - 1273  <http://www.njatwork.com/> www.njatwork.com

item.description:

We are looking for a Full Stack Java Developer for one of our client located in NY with following skills and knowledge.

Required Skills:

  • Full Stack Developer, Spring MVC, Spring Data and Strong JS experience, HTML, CSS, Design Patterns Desirable.
  • Front-end Framework: At least one of Angular/VueJS/React, NoSQL, RDBMS, Golang & Multithreading, DevOps, Automation, Experience with Git, Elasticsearch, Microservices.

  • Experience developing JAVA web applications, Front end experience using HTML, and CSS, Deep understanding of JavaScript programming (closures, promises, DOM events, inheritance, etc.).
  • Experience with a client-side JavaScript framework (AngularJS, ReactJS, Ember, etc.), Java-based MVC framework (Spring MVC a plus), RESTful web services Roles

Responsibilities:  

  • Designing, implementing, and maintaining web applications that are often high-volume
  • Contributing in all phases of the development lifecycle.
  • Writing well-designed, efficient, and testable code.
  • Conducting software analysis, programming, testing, and debugging.
  • Managing Java and Java EE application development.
  • Ensuring designs comply with specifications.
  • Preparing and producing releases of software components.

item.title: Collection Officer
item.description:
Essential functions:

 

Responsible for managing delinquencies in addition to the control of late and/or delinquent loan accounts and pending late payment reminders. Make follow up telephone calls on delinquent loan and maintain accurate records on delinquent loans accounts.

Optimize collections on accounts while balancing the goodwill of members with the overall business interest of the credit union.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Managing the collection efforts/calls
  • Documenting daily collections activity
  • Identifying delinquent accounts requiring external collection efforts.
  • Identifying bad debt or financial exposure.
  • Monitor payments for late and/or delinquent status. Follow up on delinquent, high balance, and overdue credit balance accounts by telephone and /or letter. Ensure professional interface with members.
  • Contact high balance and/or delinquent member by telephone and mail to determine the reason for balance or delinquency, and assist them in developing plans to bring accounts wherever possible.
  • Notify co-signers regarding status of delinquent accounts.
  • Update files and system accounts via the credit union’s delinquent loan recovery system.
  • Skip trace on loans. Maintain accurate data for repossession log, bankruptcy files, and charge-offs list, etc.
  • Research payroll deductions, stop, start, and changes as they may affect the status of the loan repayment.
  • Assist members with delinquent real estate loans to resolve delinquency.
  • Determine when to compromise and settle balances and when to initiate foreclosure or repossession.
  • File claims, attend hearings, and coordinate with trustees for all bankruptcy filings.
  • Investigate and correct discrepancies in loan applications and credit bureau reposts.
  • WorkwithLoanOfficeronTDRs and Deferments, (including policy and procedures)

     

    Education and Skill Experience:
  • Excellent customer service, negotiation, communication and analytical skills.
  • An associate or bachelor’s degree in accounting or related area is preferred.
  • Financial institution experience with similar job functions and 1-5 years’ collection experience.
  • Strong interpersonal skills (oral and written communications).
  • Must be able to work independently as well as in a team environment.
  • Proficient in office equipment such as, but not limited to PC, 10-Key calculator, copier and software such as MS Word, Excel with the ability to learn new software programs as required.

Required work authorization:

United States

Please call us at 609.454.6786 for more information

ATWork Personnel Services 3535 Quakerbridge Rd, Suite 102, Hamilton, NJ 08619 Ph: (609) 454 - 6786 |Fax: (609) 423 - 1273  <http://www.njatwork.com/> www.njatwork.com

item.description:
Looking for a Bookkeeper. To ensure accurate accounting records for receipts and/or disbursements within the County. This is a responsible non supervisory position. Posts requisitions, receipts, and disbursements information to appropriate ledgers or journals. Receives and counts cash; maintains cash book or other control record. Prepares and mails bills or statements, or prepares lists of outstanding bills payable. knowledge of Quick Books is must.  Reports to an elected official, department head, or another designated person.

Large manufacturing firm in Overland area is currently looking to add to its team. We need (2) detailed individuals who can read skew numbers and pull product from stock. Knowledge of  Fed Ex and/or UPS shipping software is a plus.  These are temp-to-perm opportunities with a great company!

item.title: Jr. Recruiter
item.description:
Job Summary: Individuals with industry experience in either manufacturing, retail, restaurant or staffing working as production associates, waitress, bartender, shift supervisors, managers or retail associates we want to talk to you!!!

Great Career Opportunity!

Since 1992, we have successfully identified, recruited, and selected top quality candidates for some the best companies in America! The @WORK Group is a leader in the staffing industry, with 63 offices nationwide. The @WORK Group is a leader in the staffing industry, with nearly 100 offices nationwide. Awarded Top US Staffing firm and Best of Staffing by Inaverno/CareerBuilder, two years in a row. We are currently looking for a Staffing Recruiter to join our winning team

This is the people business and we’re changing lives. If you are interested in making a difference in the lives of others, then please apply.

We presently have a Staffing Specialist position available for someone with experience finding great talent and making the perfect staffing match for our clients. We have an excellent value proposition for the light industrial and general clerical staffing segments of our market, and an excellent track record of serving and retaining clients.

Position Highlights

Seeking a recruiter who can aggressively source candidates in the industrial, clerical, technical, and professional fields. Must have experience with face to face interviewing and virtual recruiting. Must be able to make GREAT placements in a fast-paced environment, excellent communication skills with the clients and be able to travel to locations on a short notice.

The following skills are preferred:

*Outgoing, friendly, and confident personality

*Strong work ethic and a desire to succeed

*Thrives in a fast-paced environment

*Competitive yet comfortable working in a team environment

*Entrepreneurial spirit and professionally-motivated

Does the following describe you?

  • Are you a self -starter?Staffing is a fast-paced environment and to be successful you must be great at prioritizing your time.
  • Do you enjoy building relationships with others?Recruiters are relationship builders. They help companies grow and thrive and also help candidates find jobs in their chosen profession.
  • How well do you handle rejection?As with most positions that require a certain degree of sales, sometimes you face rejection. A good recruiter doesn’t let negative responses prevent them from moving forward. They continue to develop client relationships and source quality candidates despite a few setbacks.
  • Do you enjoy research?Recruiters have to be industry experts. Companies rely on recruiters to keep up with industry trends and have a good working knowledge of the business. As a result, recruiters must research the competition, join trade associations, and read literature.

Job Summary:

As a staffing specialist, responsibilities include sourcing, evaluating, engaging, and managing candidates through the recruiting life cycle. Additionally, the position is responsible for managing relationships with clients, including candidate presentation, order taking, and order management.

Essential Functions:

  • Acts as the primary liaison between AtWork and the Customer. Responsible for growing relationships and creating new opportunities with assigned accounts.
  • Communicates with customers by phone or in person and receives orders, enters and maintains data and all pertinent activity in Avionte for applicants, orders, and clients.
  • Oversees and responds to concerns regarding the employee’s performance for the customer including counseling, disciplining, termination and removal of the job assignment.
  • Independently follows up with clients with a high sense of urgency to deliver bad/good news.
  • Self-sufficiently resolves customer complaints in an effective manner.
  • Identifies and works to resolve customer/applicant related issues with a high sense of urgency, while consistently looking for opportunities to improve the customer experience.
  • Manage and communicate job postings
  • Schedule and conduct phone and face to face interviews.
  • Interview effectively so as to understand the technical depths of each and every candidate you meet.
  • Work with our customer facing Account Executives to understand client needs and requirements, take those requirements and identify and match them with appropriate candidates.
  • Be honest and respectful of anyone and everyone you interact with.
  • follow up with the professionals you’re working with as well as those who are on projects at our clients.

Participate in training including product, software and sales training
item.job:requirements:
Required Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of recruiting, customer service and/or sales experience
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • History of success in recruiting or sales
  • Strong computer skills with strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite
  • interest and aptitude in technology
  • Ability to communicate clearly and positively to our candidates and clients as well as internal team members

Proven performance succeeding in an organization with clear and aggressive goals

item.title: Package Handler
item.description:
Package Handlers offload and sort incoming packages for distribution and/or prepare outgoing freight for delivery by performing the following duties.

  1. Maintain and contribute to a safe work environment by adhering to policies and procedures as outlined in the Company Safety Program.
  2. Offload all inbound freight for distribution.
  3. Sort packages according to destination by sort code.
  4. Check for incorrect zip codes and destination codes to prevent mis-sorted packages.
  5. Examine appearance of outgoing packages for damage.
  6. Load all sorted freight on outbound trucks.
  7. Perform any other task or assignment as deemed necessary by the organization.

Package Handlers:

  • Are eligible for sick pay, after completion of an eligibility period
  • Are eligible to participate in the 401k program, after completion of specific criteria
  • Are eligible for $.50 pay increases within the first six months of employment and every six months after, up to two years
  • Are eligible for a $100 referral bonus, after completion of specific criteria
  • Have access to online medical care through Teledoc, $15 copay
  • Have the opportunity to advance and transfer within the company!

Candidates must successfully complete all pre-employment screenings, which include physical, lift test, drug test, and background check. Candidates must have the ability to read and understand English and apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written or oral form.

The physical activity associated with this position is considered high. The employee will regularly lift, push, pull and/or move items averaging 50 pounds and occasionally up to 75.

Candidates must be at least 18 years old, possess valid identification, and be able to pass a TSA screening.  High school diploma or general education degree (GED) preferred; or 1 to 3 months related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of both. This is a safety sensitive position.

Wages and benefits are governed by a union contract. Company provides uniforms, on-site training and career advancement opportunities. Please come to our office listed below to apply for the position

item.title: Quality Assurance - Mechanical Inspector
item.description:
Leading Manufacturing company in Riverside, California seeks detail oriented and effective Mechanical Inspector to work in its Quality Assurance Department. 

Primary Duties of the Mechanical Inspector - Quality Assurance•

Inspect machined parts, purchased parts, and assemblies.  Prepare written inspection reports, including AS9102 forms.  Performing First Article Inspection Reports, in-process and final inspections. Responsible for writing NCRs
item.job:requirements:
Candidate must have practical experience performing First Article Inspection Reports, in-process and final inspections on machined parts or assemblies to drawing or specification using visual and/or precision mechanical techniques and tools, including indicators, micrometers, microscope, performs advanced surface plate set-ups, records and reports inspection findings. The inspections will be performed to engineering requirements. Read blueprints or engineering specifications to obtain product information, such as specified material, surface finish, and dimensions. Must be willing to work overtime as required.

Minimum Requirements

  • High School Diploma or equivalent, some college or trade school education a plus
  • Excellent communication and writing skills
  • 3-5 years precision mechanical inspection experience
  • Ability to use standard inspection tools, e.g., micrometers, calipers, microscope, CMM, VMM: OGP and height gauge
  • Working knowledge and experience with Microsoft Word, and Excel

item.title: Manual Machine Operator
item.description:
AtWork is currently looking for Manual Machine Operators with Lathe/Mill/Grinder experience to join our client in South Fort Worth!  
 
Job Summary

Responsible for operating machine tools to produce precision metal parts. Produces small batches or large quantities of metal parts. Ensure products meet precise specifications.

Primary responsibilities
  • Operate machine tools such as lathes, milling machines, and grinders to produce metal parts.
  • Review electronic or written blueprints or specifications for a job.
  • Calculate where to cut or bore.
  • Shape steel, aluminum, titanium, plastic, silicon and other materials.
  • Determine how fast or slow work piece is fed into machine.
  • Determine how much material to remove.
  • Select tools and materials for the job.
  • Plan the sequence of cutting and finishing operations.
  • Mark the work piece to show where cuts should be made.
  • Position work piece on the drill press, lathe, or milling machine.
  • Monitor and control feed rate and speed.
  • Ensure work piece is properly lubricated and/or cooled.
  • Regulate temperature of work piece.
  • Detect problems by listening for specific sounds.
  • Adjust cutting speed to compensate for harmonic vibrations.
  • Monitor the accuracy of cuts.
  • Replace dull cutting tools.
  • Check accuracy of work against blueprints and specifications.
  • Produce large quantities of parts.
  • Determine how automated equipment will cut a part.
  • Determine cutting path.
  • Concert path, speed, and feed information into set of instructions for machine tool.
  • Use manual and computer-controlled machinery.
  • Write basic programs.
  • Modify programs in response to problems.

Job Requirements

Candidates will have 2-3 years of Manual Machine Operating experience!!

Walk-ins Welcomed Mon-Thurs from 9am-3pm!!

AtWork Personnel Services

3901 W. Vickery Blvd, Ste 5

Fort Worth, TX 76107

817-993-6300

item.title: Dock Auditor
item.description:
Job Title: Dock Auditor

Location: Sterling Heights MI

Type: Full Time/Permanent

Shift: 2nd  (2pm-10pm)

 

Job Summary

Dock Auditor. ... The Warehouse Auditor is responsible for auditing orders on the dock to ensure the correct quantity and products are being shipped to the customer. Auditors assist in maintaining an acceptable error rate on orders shipped according to guidelines.

 

Job Description

 

Dock Auditor 

  • Audit final packaged product at prescribed frequency to verify weight, # of pieces,

ensure correct documentation is present, and that container product is in good

condition.

  • Audit incoming product from subcontractors to verify applicable documentation is

present.

  • Audit incoming product from subcontractors to verify quality of work preferred, as

appropriate.

  • Maintain documentation showing the checks completed for each day.
  • Perform all duties as requested by supervisor.

 

All shifts - including 2nd and 3rd, with sporadic 1st shift availability.

The Data Entry Clerk accurately enters data into a computer. This data includes quantities, lot codes, item numbers, sales order numbers, dates and freight rates. In addition, the data entry clerk will print documents such as bills of lading and packing lists for delivery personnel. The data entry clerk provides support to the warehouse operation.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Promotes safety and conducts him/herself in accordance with all safety guidelines at all times.
  • Utilize Syspro ( ERP System) to update sales orders for shipment.
  • Reads source documents such as pick lists to verify order accuracy in Syspro.
  • Resolves discrepancies on picked orders.
  • Obtain rate quotes for LTL carriers.
  • Verify accuracy of shipping documents.
  • Files completed documents and copies in appropriate locations.
  • Identify and correct data entry errors and report them to supervisors when necessary.
  • Prints bill of lading and shipping documents for all shipments.
  • Utilize standard office equipment.
  • Punctual and on time.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

  • Must be able to physically perform the functions of climbing, balancing, stooping, kneeling, crouching, reaching, standing, walking, pushing, pulling, lifting, grasping, feeling, talking, hearing, and repetitive motions. Those typically found in a logistics and warehouse setting.
  • Must possess visual acuity to document company records.
  • Must be able to lift 40 pounds.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Must demonstrate attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy.
  • Must work well in a team environment.
  • Must be able to work overtime as required.
  • Must have good job performance and attendance records.

item.title: Jr. Recruiter
item.description:
Job Title:Staffing Specialist

Reports  Major Accounts Manager

Supervises:[ all contract associates]

Status:exempt

Location: Sterling Heights

 

Job Summary: Individuals with industry experience in either manufacturing, retail, restaurant or staffing working as production associates, waitress, bartender, shift supervisors, managers or retail associates we want to talk to you!!!

Great Career Opportunity!

Since 1992, we have successfully identified, recruited, and selected top quality candidates for some the best companies in America! The @WORK Group is a leader in the staffing industry, with 63 offices nationwide. The @WORK Group is a leader in the staffing industry, with nearly 100 offices nationwide. Awarded Top US Staffing firm and Best of Staffing by Inaverno/CareerBuilder, two years in a row. We are currently looking for a Staffing Recruiter to join our winning team

This is the people business and we’re changing lives. If you are interested in making a difference in the lives of others, then please apply.

We presently have a Staffing Specialist position available for someone with experience finding great talent and making the perfect staffing match for our clients. We have an excellent value proposition for the light industrial and general clerical staffing segments of our market, and an excellent track record of serving and retaining clients.

Position Highlights

Seeking a recruiter who can aggressively source candidates in the industrial, clerical, technical, and professional fields. Must have experience with face to face interviewing and virtual recruiting. Must be able to make GREAT placements in a fast-paced environment, excellent communication skills with the clients and be able to travel to locations on a short notice.

The following skills are preferred:

*Outgoing, friendly, and confident personality

*Strong work ethic and a desire to succeed

*Thrives in a fast-paced environment

*Competitive yet comfortable working in a team environment

*Entrepreneurial spirit and professionally-motivated

Does the following describe you?

  • Are you a self -starter?Staffing is a fast-paced environment and to be successful you must be great at prioritizing your time.
  • Do you enjoy building relationships with others?Recruiters are relationship builders. They help companies grow and thrive and also help candidates find jobs in their chosen profession.
  • How well do you handle rejection?As with most positions that require a certain degree of sales, sometimes you face rejection. A good recruiter doesn’t let negative responses prevent them from moving forward. They continue to develop client relationships and source quality candidates despite a few setbacks.
  • Do you enjoy research?Recruiters have to be industry experts. Companies rely on recruiters to keep up with industry trends and have a good working knowledge of the business. As a result, recruiters must research the competition, join trade associations, and read literature.

Job Summary:

As a staffing specialist, responsibilities include sourcing, evaluating, engaging, and managing candidates through the recruiting life cycle. Additionally, the position is responsible for managing relationships with clients, including candidate presentation, order taking, and order management.

Essential Functions:

  • Acts as the primary liaison between AtWork and the Customer. Responsible for growing relationships and creating new opportunities with assigned accounts.
  • Communicates with customers by phone or in person and receives orders, enters and maintains data and all pertinent activity in Avionte for applicants, orders, and clients.
  • Oversees and responds to concerns regarding the employee’s performance for the customer including counseling, disciplining, termination and removal of the job assignment.
  • Independently follows up with clients with a high sense of urgency to deliver bad/good news.
  • Self-sufficiently resolves customer complaints in an effective manner.
  • Identifies and works to resolve customer/applicant related issues with a high sense of urgency, while consistently looking for opportunities to improve the customer experience.
  • Manage and communicate job postings
  • Schedule and conduct phone and face to face interviews.
  • Interview effectively so as to understand the technical depths of each and every candidate you meet.
  • Work with our customer facing Account Executives to understand client needs and requirements, take those requirements and identify and match them with appropriate candidates.
  • Be honest and respectful of anyone and everyone you interact with.
  • follow up with the professionals you’re working with as well as those who are on projects at our clients.
  • Participate in training including product, software and sales training.

Required Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of recruiting, customer service and/or sales experience
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • History of success in recruiting or sales
  • Strong computer skills with strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite
  • interest and aptitude in technology
  • Ability to communicate clearly and positively to our candidates and clients as well as internal team members

Proven performance succeeding in an organization with clear and aggressive goals

 

 

Desired Skills:

  • Team player with a positive attitude
  • Well demonstrated time-management and problem-solving skills
  • A quick study with an affinity for detail and willingness to learn
  • Problem solver with strong analytical skills
  • Proven interpersonal skills in a team environment

item.title: 2nd Shift Quality Assurance Tech
item.description:
Second Shift Quality Assurance Tech needed for busy Central Asheville Manufacturing Facility

Attention to detail a MUST and prior Quality experience preferred - APPLY TODAY!!

M - F, 3pm - 11pm
item.job:requirements:
Job Duties

Monitor product quality through regular sampling of cards in active production and performing visual and quantitative tests, including barcode and mag stripe encoding quality.  Ensure product matches the appropriate job instructions including artwork and data proofs.  Manage line rejects.  Prepare production reports and perform various computer data-entry tasks.

Responsibilities

  • Inspect product on the manufacturing floor and in the QA Lab
  • Sample active production and perform qualitative and quantitative testing
  • Audit manufacturing process compliance at different stages
  • Follow job ticket information for the specifications of product and materials
  • Use test equipment to evaluate characteristics of raw material and finished goods
  • Use computer systems to track their time, activities, and product movements
  • Work as part of the team to coordinate compliance to ship dates.

 

Skills

  1. HS Diploma or GED
  2. Ability to read, write, speak, and understand English
  3. Attention to detail and accuracy
  4. Able to work well independently or in a team
  5. Excellent verbal skills to communicate with employees on the production floor and stop the production process when a defect or flaw is identified
  6. Good analytical and problem solving skills
  7. High standard in computer literacy
  8. Ability to become technically competent in the manufacturing process to be managed
  9. Ability to prioritize work and work as a team to meet shared schedules

 

Physical Requirements: 

 

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions.

 

  1. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, speak, hear and comprehend. The employee is required to stand for extended period of time; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms on a daily basis.  The employee must be able to lift up to 25 pounds on a regular basis.  Specific vision abilities required by this job include the ability to adjust focus, detect fine details, and discern colors and slight shade differences.

 

 

Work Environment: 

 

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions.

 

  1. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is primarily in an indoor setting, but may be exposed to variable temperature conditions indoor and outside (occasionally extreme heat or extreme cold). The employee is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts, toxic or caustic chemicals, and dust and/or mite hazards.  The employee must be prepared to respond to emergencies should they occur.  The noise level in the environment is usually moderate.

item.title: 2nd Shift/ Line Leader
item.description:
Position:Team Leader

Industry:Automotive

Job Type:Full Time/Permanent

Shift: 2nd 4 p.m.-12 a.m.

Location: Sterling Heights MI

Compensation: 12.25

Job Summary

Supervises the activities of production personnel engaged in all facets of the manufacturing function. A level I supervisor is considered a working supervisor with little authority for personnel actions. May require a bachelor's degree in area of specialty. Familiar with a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures. Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected. Typically reports to a manager or head of a unit/department.

Duties & Responsibilities Information:

  • Ensures workstations meet all safety, 1+5S and TPM requirements by being actively involved with the assessment of all workstations per Quality and 1+5S guidelines
  • Reviews all Method Sheets that apply to work performed within the department and facilitates training of all employees per proper Method Sheets and Training Procedures with HR
  • Facilitates proper scanning of work orders within the Oracle Production System to ensure accurate production reporting and inventory; ensures all rework tickets are filled out and turned in to the proper department
  • Influences team members by displaying a positive proactive work ethic that sets the standards for maintaining a safe, productive work environment while setting and maintaining high quality standards and striving for continuous improvement
  • Functions as a working production team member as needed
  • Maintains and conducts meetings in Supervisors absence
  • Facilitates and helps maintain all lean enterprise initiatives
  • Signs off on all completed department outbound production prior to movement to the next level of production
  • Performs other duties as assigned by Supervisor or Team Leader

 

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $12.25 /hour

item.title: Solder Technician
item.description:
Please note, this position starts part time but will quickly move to full time depending on employee performance. This is a temp to hire position after 90 days. Pay starts at 10.00 per hour raises are based on employee performance

Must have electronics and soldering experience .

Position: Electronics Assembler

Job Description:

  • 1) Performs any combination of following tasks to assemble electronic components, subassemblies, products, or systems: Reads work orders, follows production drawings and sample assemblies, or receives verbal instructions regarding duties to be performed.
  • 2) Positions and aligns parts in specified relationship to each other in jig, fixture, or other holding device.
  • 3) Crimps, stakes, screws, bolts, rivets, welds, solders, cements, press fits, or performs similar operations to join or secure parts in place, using handtools, power tools, machines, and equipment.
  • 4) Mounts assembled components, such as transformers, resistors, transistors, capacitors, integrated circuits, and sockets, on chassis panel.
  • 5) Connects component lead wires to printed circuit or routes and connects wires between individual component leads and other components, connectors, terminals, and contact points, using soldering, welding, thermocompression, or related bonding procedures and equipment.
  • 6) Installs finished assemblies or subassemblies in cases and cabinets.
  • 7) Assembles and attaches hardware, such as caps, clamps, knobs, and switches, to assemblies.
  • 8) Performs intermediate assembly tasks, such as potting, encapsulating, sanding, cleaning, epoxy bonding, curing, stamping, etching, impregnating, and color coding parts and assemblies.
  • 9) Tends machines that press, shape, or wind component parts.
  • 10) Adjusts or trims materials from components to achieve specified electrical or dimensional characteristics.
  • 11) Performs on-line go-not-go testing and inspection, using magnifying devices, measuring instruments, and electronic test equipment, to ensure parts and assemblies meet production specifications and standards.
  • 12) May perform assembly operations under microscope or other magnifying device.
  • 13) Occupations related to assembly of printed circuit boards and fabrication of integrated circuit chips are defined under separate definitions

item.title: Account Manager/Sales
item.description:
Account Manager

Due to continued growth, Atwork Personnel Services is looking to hire a Staffing Account Manager. This Account Manager will be responsible for the sales process of short and long-term initiatives and staffing requirements by identifying and securing business opportunities and managing existing relationships with new and established clients.

Compensation

Paid per hour based on experience plus monthly commission.

Job Description

We are looking for a passionate Account Manager who will be a team player to ensure the long-term relationship with our customers and success of AtWork Personnel Services.

You will be responsible for the long-term relationship with our clients, connecting with Human Resource Managers, Department Managers, and key business executives. You will be a liaison between clients and Staffing Coordinators to ensure timely and successful solutions according to the client’s needs.

 

Responsibilities 

  • Research and source potential candidates through Internet searches and job boards.
  • Cold calling, whether being on the phone or going business to business.
  • Enter clients into data base and keeping needed notes on clients.
  • If needed, assist in reviewing applications and resumes to qualify potential candidates.
  • Interviewing potential candidates.
  • Call and set meetings with client’s key management and executives.
  • Conduct meeting with potential clients.
  • Develop and maintain a relationship with clients.
  • Assist in career fairs.
  • Identify and grow opportunities within the territory.

 

Requirements

  • Proven account management or other relevant experience.
  • Experience on delivering client staffing solutions based on client’s needs.
  • Proven ability to manage multiple projects at a time while paying attention to detail.
  • Excellent listening, negotiation and presentation skills.
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills.
  • Must be a self-starter, well organized, and reliable.

item.title: WAREHOUSE WORKER
item.description:
WAREHOUSE WORKER

Job Announcement:

Steady growing warehouse seeks an upbeat Warehouse Worker to add to their team! The ideal candidate would be a team player who enjoys working at a steady pace and adapts to new innovations well.

Job Description:

Perform a wide variation of warehouse operations including processing and receiving incoming product. Ideal candidate must versatile and adapt quickly to change.

 Job Responsibilities:

  • Assist with shipping and receiving unloading trucks and checking in merchandise
  • Prepares orders by processing requests and supply orders; pulling materials; packing boxes; placing orders in delivery area
  • Sort and place materials or items on racks, shelves or in bins according to organizational standards
  • Maintains consistent inventory by collecting stock location orders, printing request, recording amounts of materials or items received or distributed through a computer.
  • Cycle count physical inventory
  • Prepare parcels for mailing
  • Maintains safe and clean work environment by keeping shelves, pallet area, and work stations neat; Sweep, dust and mop.
  • Wear the proper safety equipment

Location:

                Raleigh Area, North Carolina, USA

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, creed, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, citizen status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, family medical leave status, or protected veterans’ status.
item.job:requirements:
Qualifications

 

  • High School diploma or equivalent preferred
  • 1-2 yrs previous warehouse experience preferred
  • Good communication, organizational, time management mathematical skills
  • Team Player
  • Inventory, Equipment maintenance, data entry and computer skills may be required
  • Must be able to lift objects weighing 10-50lbs

item.title: Payroll Administrator
item.description:
PAYROLL ADMINISTRATOR

Job Announcement:

Looking for gainful employment and have great administrative skills? A fast-growing business seeks a detail-oriented Payroll Administrator.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Document the quantity and type of equipment, merchandise, and/or supplies stocked in warehouse and/or on vans as well as all of the materials needed for the different types of installations and service calls.
  • Keep record of inventory, equipment and merchandise stocked in the warehouse.

 

  • Maintain an accurate physical count of van product, warehouse product and saleable products on a daily, weekly and/or monthly basis

 

  • Receive returned equipment, new inventory and vendor shipments, stocks the inventory in the warehouse, and prepares shipments for return to the remanufacturing department and records distributed hardware information in the computer tracking system.

 

  • Complete daily inventory transactions for all product used, linking them to the proper accounts.
  • Assist supervisor with all inventory replenishment reports and inventory related communications with other departments.

 

 Qualifications:

Education and Experience

Graduation from high school and one (1) year experience in a computer-aided

warehousing operation, or any equivalent combination of education and experience to

include one (1) year experience in forklift operation.

Location:

            Raleigh Area, North Carolina, USA

 

 

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, creed, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, citizen status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, family medical leave status, or protected veterans’ status.

item.description:
AtWork has partnered with our client, located in the Sacramento area, who is seeking a Business Analyst on an in-house, contract basis.  The deal candidate will have more than five years experience in data gathering, research and analytics, problem identification and presenting solutions.  

 

Business Analyst will provide the process, questions, and techniques to efficiently extract the information needed from the business users for successful business solution and application development projects.

 

Job functions/Requirements:

  • Five years in-depth knowledge of project planning.
  • Ability to document, propose, negotiate and present approaches and solutions. 
  • Proficient at facilitating meetings, and negotiating across all levels of the organization.
  • Excellent communication skills are required.
  • Proficient with MS Office suite and Visio.

 

This is a long term, in-house contract position.  This opportunity is not a remote position.

 

Apply today for immediate consideration!

  • Influences team members by displaying a positive proactive work ethic that sets the standards for maintaining a safe, productive work environment while setting and maintaining high quality standards and striving for continuous improvement
  • Functions as a working production team member as needed
  • Maintains First5 Boards and conducts First5 Meeting in Supervisors absence
  • Facilitates and helps maintain all lean enterprise initiatives
  • Signs off on all completed department outbound production prior to movement to the next level of production
  • Performs other duties as assigned by Supervisor or Team Leader

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $11.25 /hour

item.title: Staffing Recruiter
item.description: We’re looking for Staffing Recruiters to join our team. Staffing Recruiters are inside sales representatives who are sharing amazing job and company opportunities with skilled candidates. To help their clients fill specific high-priority positions, Staffing Recruiters post job listings, find and reach out to qualified candidates, and manage the candidate experience throughout the recruitment process after job placement.
item.job:requirements: The best Staffing Recruiters are motivated, competitive, and detail-oriented. When we hire, we also look for: • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience • Self-starters • Process- and Solution-oriented • Ability to build strong relationships • Ability to be direct and have difficult conversations • Excellent communication skills • Excellent organizational skills • Ability to multitask and meet deadlines • Enthusiastic people with Can-do attitudes • Team players who are coachable and receptive to feedback

item.title: INVENTORY SUPPLY SPECIALIST
item.description:
Job Announcement:

Looking to grow your career? Immediate gainful employment with a large industrial distributor is looking for a detailed-oriented Inventory Supply Specialist/Associate.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Receive and keep record of inventory, merchandise and equipment stocked in the warehouse and received from vendors.

 

  • Sustain an accurate physical count of warehouse product and saleable products on a daily, weekly and/or monthly basis.

 

  • Record and audit inventory to keep the computer tracking system in balance.

 

  • Stocks the inventory in the warehouse and prepares shipments for return to the remanufacturing department

 

  • Complete daily inventory transactions for all product used, linking them to the proper accounts.

 

  • Assist supervisor with all inventory replenishment reports and inventory related communications with other departments.

 

 

Location:

            Raleigh Area, North Carolina, USA

 

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, creed, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, citizen status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, family medical leave status, or protected veterans’ status.
item.job:requirements:
Qualifications:

  • High School Diploma or GED strongly preferred. Generally, 1-3 years’ experience in purchasing, inventory or related field.
  • Must be willing to meet company safety, accuracy and productivity standards
  • Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
  • Must possess strong organizational and communication skills.
  • Critical thinking skills and accuracy are necessary to perform essential job functions.

item.title: Forklift/ Pallet Jack Operator
item.description:
Forklift/ Pallet Jack Operator

Job Announcement:

Local growing warehouse seeks a Forklift/ Pallet Jack Operator.  The prime function of this position is to provide support to the supply chain through shipping and receiving warehouse products. The candidate will be responsible for operating technical equipment and safely executing the job assignments.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Take orders from supervisors for order picking activities.
  • Assist in loading and unloading items from delivery trucks
  • Prepare pallets for handling objects appropriately.
  • Perform pre-checks on electric pallet jacks to ensure that they are in proper working order.
  • Pick orders from storage areas and verify the accuracy of order from order sheet.
  • Count quantity of items asked for by the customer and ensure that any broken things are isolated and reported to the supervisor immediately.
  • Make sure that any unusual incidents or accidents are reported to the supervisor immediately
  • Operate electric pallet jack to lift and transport items to the labeling and quality control section.
  • Make sure that all items are boxed and appropriately labeled.
  • Will be required to stand and lift items up to 30lbs - 40lbs.
  • Transport items to the delivery pallets safely and urgently.
  • Perform minor troubleshooting activities when needed.

 

 

 

Location:

            Raleigh Area, North Carolina, USA

 

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, creed, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, citizen status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, family medical leave status, or protected veterans’ status.
item.job:requirements:
Qualifications:

  • To obtain employment as a Forklift/ Pallet Jack Operator, you should possess a high school diploma or a GED at the very least. You need to be pallet jack or forklift certified. Experience in warehouse setting will be a plus.

item.title: Accounting Clerk
item.description:
Accounting Clerk

Job Announcement:

A growing business is looking for an Accounting Clerk to join their administrative staff. The successful candidate will be responsible for payable and receivable accounts, balancing department budgets, invoicing clients, and maintaining a comprehensive financial filing system

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Provide accounting and clerical support to the accounting department
  • Type accurately, prepare and maintain accounting documents and records
  • Prepare bank deposits, general ledger postings and statements
  • Reconcile accounts in a timely manner
  • Daily enter key data of financial transactions in database
  • Provide assistance and support to company personnel
  • Research, track and restore accounting or documentation problems and discrepancies
  • Inform management and compile reports/summaries on activity areas
  • Function in accordance with established standards, procedures and applicable laws
  • Constantly update job knowledge

 

Location:

 

            Raleigh Area, North Carolina, USA

 

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, creed, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, citizen status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, family medical leave status, or protected veterans’ status.
item.job:requirements:
Qualifications:

  • Proven accounting experience, preferably as an Accounts receivable clerkor Accounts payable clerk
  • Familiarity with bookkeepingand basic accounting procedures
  • Competency in MS Office, databases and accounting software
  • Hands-on experience with spreadsheets and financial reports
  • Accuracy and attention to detail
  • Aptitude for numbers
  • Ability to perform filing and record keeping tasks
  • Data entry and word processing skills
  • Well organized
  • High school degree
  • Associate degree or relevant certification is a plus

item.title: Wiring Technician
item.description:
Wiring & Soldering Associate needed for busy North Asheville Manufacturing Facility

M-F 7am-3:30pm

Temp to Hire, with full benefits package upon permanent placement

Drug Test/Background Check Required

Essential Duties/Responsibilities:

Assemble cables and electronic components per blueprints and specifications. Involves using a variety of specialized tools for measuring, soldering to IPC standards, and safe handling of ESD sensitive components. 

Basic Skills/Qualifications:

Ability to read and accurately interpret blueprints and schematics

Follow systematic instructions and pay attention to detail

Excellent documentation, prioritization, and organization skills

Self-motivated and able to work with minimum supervision

Willingness and ability to work varied schedules, overtime, and holidays; conveyed on short notice

Ability to solder and crimp connections

Team oriented

 

Education/Experience:

Previous soldering experience preferred

Previous experience in assembly of multi-conductor cables to multi-pin connectors highly preferred

item.title: Manufacturing Quality Assurance Tech - Central Asheville
item.description:
Second Shift Quality Assurance Tech needed for busy Central Asheville Manufacturing Facility

Attention to detail a MUST and prior Quality experience preferred - APPLY TODAY!!

M - F, 3pm - 11pm
item.job:requirements:
Job Duties

Monitor product quality through regular sampling of cards in active production and performing visual and quantitative tests, including barcode and mag stripe encoding quality.  Ensure product matches the appropriate job instructions including artwork and data proofs.  Manage line rejects.  Prepare production reports and perform various computer data-entry tasks.

Responsibilities

  • Inspect product on the manufacturing floor and in the QA Lab
  • Sample active production and perform qualitative and quantitative testing
  • Audit manufacturing process compliance at different stages
  • Follow job ticket information for the specifications of product and materials
  • Use test equipment to evaluate characteristics of raw material and finished goods
  • Use computer systems to track their time, activities, and product movements
  • Work as part of the team to coordinate compliance to ship dates.

 

Skills

  1. HS Diploma or GED
  2. Ability to read, write, speak, and understand English
  3. Attention to detail and accuracy
  4. Able to work well independently or in a team
  5. Excellent verbal skills to communicate with employees on the production floor and stop the production process when a defect or flaw is identified
  6. Good analytical and problem solving skills
  7. High standard in computer literacy
  8. Ability to become technically competent in the manufacturing process to be managed
  9. Ability to prioritize work and work as a team to meet shared schedules

 

Physical Requirements: 

 

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions.

 

  1. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, speak, hear and comprehend. The employee is required to stand for extended period of time; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms on a daily basis.  The employee must be able to lift up to 25 pounds on a regular basis.  Specific vision abilities required by this job include the ability to adjust focus, detect fine details, and discern colors and slight shade differences.

 

 

Work Environment: 

 

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions.

 

  1. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is primarily in an indoor setting, but may be exposed to variable temperature conditions indoor and outside (occasionally extreme heat or extreme cold). The employee is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts, toxic or caustic chemicals, and dust and/or mite hazards.  The employee must be prepared to respond to emergencies should they occur.  The noise level in the environment is usually moderate.

item.title: Facility Maintenance Tech
item.description:
Central Asheville Manufacturing Facility seeking 2nd Shift Facilities Technician

$15 - $17/BOE

M-F, 3pm-11pm

Living Wage Certified Manufacturer with Excellent Benefits

Primary responsibilities for the facilities technician are to carry out the day to day facility requirements for both physical locations.

This will include tasks in multiple fields such as carpentry, electrical, heating, ventilation, HVAC, plumbing, phone and data and general project work as assigned .

  • Maintain, repair and perform preventative maintenance on facility equipment.
  • Run conduit, data, phone lines, air and water lines as required.
  • Perform minor electrical maintenance such as replacement of fluorescent bulbs and ballasts, fuses, cords and cord caps, etc.
  • Perform minor plumbing maintenance such as replacement or repair of leaky drains and faucets, unclogging drains, replacing drain lines, etc.
  • Perform day to day project work such as office equipment assembly and re-positioning, painting, picture hanging and a variety of other requests.
  • Utilize PMXpert software program to work order parts and equipment for repairs and facility PM's.
  • Perform these and other duties as assigned by supervisor or other appropriate management personnel.
  • Certification or Diploma in any trade such as plumbing, HVAC or welding preferred.
  • Three years minimum work experience in an industrial or building maintenance setting.
  • Ability to read, write, speak, and understand English.
  • Physically able to use man lifts and tools to run phone and data lines, water lines, air lines and conduit and to perform lighting and other facility pm procedures.
  • Ability to operate mills, lathes, welders and other equipment preferred.
  • Good computer, math and reading skills.
  • Must be flexible and able to work any shift sometimes at short notice.
  • Detail oriented, have good organizational skills and the ability to multi-task.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Ability to stand for a long period of time and lift up to 50 lbs on a regular basis.

item.title: Construction Technician Trainee
item.description:
Company specializes in the service and replacement of doors, windows, and basic home weatherization repairs. 

Includes insulation material and attic vents and barriers

Install all weatherization measures per the Weatherization Installation Standards (WIS) Manual and program guidelines

Attend weatherization training as required

Must be Bilingual Spanish

Establish and maintain effective working relationships with customers and employees

This is a Temp to Hire position for someone who is looking for long-term employment
item.job:payrate: Up to $17 hr based on experience
item.job:requirements:
High school diploma or GED preferred

2 to 3 years of construction experience and the ability to work with power tools and hand tools

Ability to follow oral and written directions in English

Must be-lingual in English and Spanish

Valid California Driver Licence and proof of current vehicle insurance and good driving record

Ability to use tablet and computers and to work OT and weekends as needed

Must be able to crawl into attics 20x20, under home crawl space 18x18, ability to lift 100lbs, and in good physical condition.
