item.title: Pharmacy Tech
item.description:
Would you like to work for a growing company that offers great benefits, growth and profit sharing?   Are you a license Pharmacy Technician?

 Apply now

 PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES, EXPECTED PROFESSIONAL COMPETENCIES

  • Thoroughly reviews prescriptions for authenticity and completeness. Consults pharmacist if there is any doubt.
  • Creates and prints labels for Pharmacy products due to ship.
  • Fills prescription for pharmacist review under the direct supervision of the pharmacist. Obtains pharmacist check 100% of the time prior to packaging prescription items for shipping.
  • Completes all computer data fields, when entering prescriptions into HDMS patient profiles for pharmacist review. Notifies pharmacist of any duplicate product entries.
  • Records all communication with patients, caregivers or doctors’ offices into the patient profiles.
  • Does not consult patients about their prescription products.
  • Contacts long-term care facilities to arrange delivery of test strips and lancets; bills the items via FSI; prints prescription labels and delivery paperwork; fills and ships products.
  • Regularly communicates with Shipping Manager to maintain adequate stock in Pharmacy.
  • Reviews, signs and dates invoices/packing slips for deliveries to the pharmacy, and obtains pharmacist co-signature 100% of the time.
  • Restocks shelves. Cycles inventory by placing older expiration dates in the back or using First In First Out, under supervision of pharmacist
  • Avoid obstruction of a patient obtaining a prescription drug and device that has been legally prescribed or ordered for the patient. If the pharmacist determines that the device or drug may cause harm to the patient, then the prescribes will be contacted for alternative therapy or to ensure the current therapy will be safe. If an item is out-of-stock, then the Undue Delay policy and procedure (VIPPS #11) will be followed.
  • Restock shelves. Cycle inventory by placing later expiration dates in the back or using First In First Out, under supervision of pharmacist
  • Aid in monthly inventory counts in pharmacy.
  • Complete and maintains all regulatory requirements, including licensing and certification, and other mandatory training within established time frames.
  • Always wear identification clearly showing they are a pharmacy technician.
  • Complete any other task assigned by the pharmacist
    • Be able to carry up to 25 lbs.
    • Must be able to work standing and walking for about 6 hours per day
item.job:requirements:
REQUIRED EDUCATION, TRAINING AND/OR PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

  • High school diploma or GED preferred
  • Computer proficiency in MS Word, Excel, and Outlook preferred
  • Solid reading, writing and mathematical skills, including addition, subtraction, multiplication and division.
  • Knowledge of diabetes is a plus
  • Clear diction and knowledge of the English language, both written and verbal
  • Work history of excellent attendance and punctuality
  • Bilingual in Spanish (read, write and speak) preferred
  • Confidence in learning new computer programs quickly.
  • Database data entry experience preferred.
  • Some experience with medical insurance and/or durable medical equipment (DME) a plus.

 

LICENSURE /CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS—

  • Required: Current and unrestricted state Pharmacy Technician license. License must be valid and maintained and is subject to verification at any time.

item.title: Housekeeping (Environmental Services)
item.description:
Housekeeper General Job Description:

Provides housekeeping services and supports the overall mission of the department.  Follows direction and guidance of the department management team.  Is responsible for the cleanliness, sanitation and safety of the hospital environment.  Is knowledgeable of related tasks, equipment, tools, chemicals and procedures.  Housekeeper role includes cleaning, restocking of supplies and disinfecting patient areas, surgery areas, bathrooms, floors, stairwells, elevators, waiting rooms and offices.  Tasks include but are not limited to: removing trash, bio-waste and soiled linen from patient care areas to designated location, wiping of surfaces and any other tasks related to the cleaning of the hospital, may include general laundry care.  The housekeeper maintains all floor areas in a safe, clean and orderly manner.  Performs specified tasks in a timely cost effective and patient focused manner while always ensuring high quality based on cleanliness and sanitation.  Inspires teamwork and provides customer service to the other departments that we interact with daily.  Treat others with respect, should be fairly self directed and have a positive attitude.  Must be able to lift, push and pull 50 pounds.

Physical Requirements:

This position includes, but is not limited to: being on your feet all day, walking, pushing carts up to 50 lbs, standing in place, bending, kneeling, lifting, reaching, for your entire shift. Can you perform the physical duties of this position daily?

You may encounter blood, vomit, urine, feces, etc. Are you able tolerate these circumstances while performing the assigned job duties?

Nicotine Policy:

This hospital is a nicotine free facility. They will do a cheek swab to determine if you use nicotine products. Nicotine products include, but are not limited to: cigarettes, nicotine patches, nicotine gum, vape, chewing tobacco, etc. You will not be employed by this facility if this test is positive for any type of nicotine use.

item.description:
Responsibilities

  • Greet all visitors courteously, determine their needs, and direct them to the proper person and/or office
  • Operate telephone system to relay incoming and interoffice calls
  • Receive, sort, and distribute incoming and outgoing mail daily to include
  • scheduling/coordinating courier shipments

  • Codes timecards and enter timecards daily
  • Reconcile timecards daily for payroll on Monday
  • Paperwork filing and file management, Email subcontractor sheets daily

item.title: Chief Financial Officer
item.description:
Commercial real estate firm is looking a Chief Financial Officer (CFO) or a Controller seeking the next step in their career. Amazing opportunity with full benefits.

Job requirements:

  • Must have 10 years' commercial real estate experience.
  • Must work well in a fast pace environment
  • Yardi experience - Yardi Investor Management Experience would be a major advantage
  • Experience with 1031 tax-deferred exchanges
  • Strong tax background
  • Have been directly involved or responsible for the preparation of annual financial statements according to GAAP.
  • Has an intimate understanding of GAAP.
  • Any knowledge on foreign investors and structure is also a plus

Additional Key Components:

  • Someone who is very hands-on - No prima donnas here
  • Strong Leadership Skills
  • Good manager of people and good mentor
  • Someone who will roll up their sleeves and help develop the accounting staff
  • Do whatever it takes attitude
  • Very fast-paced
  • Not easily flustered

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $170,000.00 to $175,000.00/year

Shifts available:**

West Phoenix- 7:00 am-7:00 pm or 7:00 pm-7:00 am with rotating days off and every other weekend off!**

Ability to read production instructions to ensure proper specs for product being produced and packed.

Must be able to read write and understand English
Must be able to pass a background check and drug screen.

Salary: $12.00 /hour

item.title: Cook
item.description:
Cook General Job Description:

Under the direction of the Nutrition Services Leadership Team:  A Cook may fulfill any number of responsibilities in relation to departmental needs, departmental operations and food preparation for patients, staff and customers of the facility.  A Cook is responsible for proper handling and preparation of all food related items as determined by daily menus.  Is responsible for using and following standardized recipes.  Accurately prepares patient meals as ordered.  Accurately prepares retail food items as needed.  Prepares food for approved events and may wait on customers of the facility as needed.  Is focused on high customer satisfaction including food quality, timely delivery and customer interactions.  Knows and follows all safety and sanitation guidelines.  Keeps all areas, tools and equipment clean.  Aware of production usage and assists with waste management.  Helps stock, rotate, and communicate inventory needs for ordering food supplies. The cook ensures delivery of high quality food items, timely service, as well as high sanitation standards.  Manages resources properly.  Provides assistance to all areas as needed including set up, preparation, clean up, sanitation of work areas, dishes, wares and/or equipment, inventory control, product rotation, proper labeling and safe food handling practices.  Is accountable for operations when the Manager and Work Leaders are not available.  Is positive and upbeat.  Maintains a professional attitude at all times.  Communicates well with others.  Able to lift, push and pull 50 pounds.

Physical Requirements:

This position includes, but is not limited to: being on your feet all day, walking, pushing carts up to 50 lbs, standing in place, bending, kneeling, lifting, reaching, for your entire shift. 

 

Nicotine Policy:

This hospital is a nicotine free facility. They will do a cheek swab to determine if you use nicotine products. Nicotine products include, but are not limited to: cigarettes, nicotine patches, nicotine gum, vape, chewing tobacco, etc. You will not be employed by this organization if this test is positive for any type of nicotine use.

item.title: Material Associate
item.description:
Responsible to receive product, deliver departmental supplies, stock inventoried supplies, pick and stage supplies to fill par levels and departmental orders, manage out-dates, accurately and timely manage code carts and other critical procedure carts replenishment, locate recalled items and process for return shipment, maintain departmental orderliness, rotate stock cycle, count inventory, provide backup for procurement and all other duties assigned. Must be able to lift 50 pounds, unload trucks, handle storeroom equipment, general math skills, good written skills. Be able to adapt to and become knowledgeable in numerous software applications. Enters data in hospital Materials Management Information System. Clean and disinfect medical equipment between patient use to assure it is ready for next patient use. May also distribute linen.

This position includes, but is not limited to: being on your feet all day, walking, pushing carts up to 50 lbs., standing in place, bending, kneeling, lifting, reaching, for your entire shift.

Nicotine Policy:

Per medical organization’s policy this is a nicotine free facility. They will do a cheek swab to determine if you use nicotine products. Nicotine products include, but are not limited to: cigarettes, nicotine patches, nicotine gum, vape, chewing tobacco, etc. You will not be employed by the medical organization if this test is positive for any type of nicotine use.

item.title: Dock Auditor 2nd shift
item.description:
Job Description

Job Title: Dock Auditor

Location: Sterling Heights MI

Shift:1:30p-9p

Job Summary

To maintain 100% accuracy to all customer shipments and vendor receipts. Ensure activities on dock are prioritized based on expectations.

Responsibilities and Duties

*

Customer Support:

  • Processes inbound and outbound EDI, including errors and customer accums.
  • Inputs manual Customer orders into QAD.
  • Creates and verifies customer ship schedules, distributes as needed to internal and external teams.
  • Maintains Customer Websites
  • eSupplier Connect
  • PC Portal II
  • SMART
  • Covisint
  • GM Supply Power
  • SPOC
  • TOMS
  • Others as needed
  • Attains POD when Customers’ needs arise.
  • Monitors and maintains Customer delivery ratings

Shipping & Receiving:

  • Sends accurate and timely ASNs.
  • Schedules Customer shipments based on Customer directives and distributes as needed to internal and external teams.
  • Creates line up sheets for Customer shipments.
  • Creates accurate shipment paperwork necessary for Customers and AGS locations.
  • Shipper
  • BOL
  • Customs
  • Others as needed
  • Creates labels for shipments per Customer or AGS requirements.
  • Monitors truck log to ensure compliance with Environmental Policy.
  • Coordinates with other shipping representatives to ensure timely call in of trucks.
  • Verifies receipt or non-receipt of material when there is a dispute between the Customer and Supplier.
  • Maintains seal control per Customer and AGS requirements.
  • Troubleshoots and correct errors on shippers/invoices to ensure the inventory and billing are correct.
  • Creates and processes RMA’s.

Additional Responsibilities:

  • Updates and maintains daily reports from QAD and distributes as needed.
  • Monitors and maintain warehouse organization
  • Performs cycle counts as scheduled.
  • Supports Management with inventory control
  • Creates a daily list of what can pack for the Service area.
  • Performs layered audits.
  • Additional tasks as required by Management.
  • Use safety processes in all work and according to AGS Health & Safety, Environmental and Housekeeping Policies.

Employment requirements:

  • Grade 12
  • One-year experience as Shipping Clerk
  • Experience in Microsoft Excel

Qualifications and Skills

-3+ Years as a Shipping Clerk or Shipping Coordinator

-Automotive Industry preferred

-GM Experience preferred.

Benefits

-2weeks Paid Vacation

-3 Week after 5 years

-Blue Cross Blue Shield Medical/Dental/Vision

-Monthly Plant Bonuses

Job Type: Full-time

item.title: Engineer
item.description:
The successful candidate will

  • Perform process engineering responsibilities of wide complexity, including process developmental and test work at the device and component level, assembly and equipment design and theory.   
  • Review and design processing methods and tooling to support product testing requirements.
  • Develop, maintain, manage, and lead and meet goals for cross functional projects, repair process development activities and new business development.  
  • Lead and coordinate with customer and engineers to conduct process equipment, prototype, experimental, and/or reliability testing.
  • Troubleshoot electronic equipment with custom and third party software and hardware tools.
  • Lead and/or assist in the determination of the Root Cause Analysis and completion of failure analysis report.
  • Create and conduct technical training with technical support, direct support and management.
item.job:requirements: Requires Bachelor's degree, and minimum 2 years' process engineering experience.

item.title: Membrane Roller
item.description:
PRINCIPLE OBJECTIVE:

Assembles raw materials to manufacture spiral wound membranes to company or customer specifications.

 

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  1. Daily production of work orders to quality and efficiency standards.
  2. Follows work order instruction and drawings in order to build to consistent standards.
  3. Records build information on work orders legibly.
  4. Uses hand tools and mechanized equipment to assist in the assembly process.
  5. Communicates issues with production quality to the Department Lead or Component Production Supervisor.
  6. Communicates issues with production equipment to the Department Lead or Component Production Supervisor.
  7. Works safely and follows safety training guidelines.
  8. Keeps the assigned production area clean and free of trash and debris.
  9. Returns tools to their designated storage area at the end of each shift.
  10. Support the execution and continuous improvement of the quality policy and procedures.
  11. Follows all company practices and supports activities, as well as safety regulation policies and procedures.
  12. Maintain consistent, responsive communication with the Production Lead.
  13. Perform other duties as assigned.

 

KEY METRICS:

  1. Monthly – A plan will be developed and provided to improve each team members skills and performance.
  2. Weekly – Monitor and review non-conformances with the Lead to drive corrective actions and ensure the incidents are not repeating.
  3. Daily – Meet the completion of the production schedule requirements.

 

CONTACTS:

Internal:                   100%       Contact with but not limited to planning, procurement, engineering, and quality personnel regarding products issues, addressing the customers’ needs and upholding the production schedule.

 

External:                  0%           Outside contact is typically not made from this position.

 

DESIRABLE QUALIFICIATIONS:

Education:               High School Diploma or equivalent is required.

 

Experience:             Previous experience is not required for this position. Prior assembly or production experience is desired. Must be organized, able to follow direction, able to read prints and work in a team environment. Having good hand eye coordination is beneficial.

                       

Physical Demand:  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

 

                                While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to sit; stand; walk; use hands; reach with hands and arms and climb or balance. The employee is sometimes required to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.

 

The noise level in the work environment is usually light to moderate; the employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.

item.title: Warehouse Order Puller/Stocker/Shipping & Recieving
item.description:
@Work Group is seeking a highly motivated and energetic Warehouse Order Puller/Receiver/Forklift Operator to join a fast growing Warehouse Distribution company in the Kilgore, TX.

Full Time

Day Shift -Early Start up times***3am & 5 am start up time

Monday - Friday

Responsibilities:

Inbound Material Handler (Receiving and Stocking):

Inbound freight is received by breaking down merchandise using a barcode scanner to ensure accuracy of receipts. Then, inventory is stocked in specified warehouse locations utilizing the scanners and industrial equipment (forklifts, pallet riders, and reach trucks)

Outbound Material Handler (Repack Orders, Full Case Orders, Shipping):

Outbound departments fill orders for customers while maintaining established quality and production standards in a voice and label picking work environment. Shipping employees build merchandise pallets into a route sequence at customer specification, ensuring an efficient load process that maximizes space utilization.

Skills and Abilities:

6 months of consecutive, verifiable work history.

6 months of Warehouse order pulling, shipping and receiving experience

6 months of Forklift/Pallet jack operating.

Must be able to pass an assessment test requiring knowledge of basic math skills and computer skills

Can work without direct supervision.

Are committed to a high standard of safety and be willing to comply with all safety policies and practices.

Have an excellent attendance record.

Are willing and able to work overtime when needed.

Have good comprehension skills.

Have the ability to interact effectively with other departments and all levels of management.

Attention to detail essential and excellent organizational skills.

Has a demonstrated ability to prioritize work as a team player with a can do attitude.

Is able to read, write, and speak English.

Has the ability to meet physical assessment requirements for this position.

If you are interested in this position please submit your resume.  Call our office at 903-508-4925 for an immediate interview!

item.title: Branch Manager
item.description:
Job Description

 

Job Title:      Branch Manager

Industry: Staffing

Reports to:   Owner

Supervises:  [all branch employees]

Status:           exempt

 

Job Summary:

Lead team to drive business performance through acquisition, coaching, business development and retention of customer relationships. The branch manager leads by example, embodying our vision statement and uncompromising principals, while continuously motivating, inspiring and developing his/her team with new challenges

Key Business Indicators

  1. Continuous sales growth
  2. High internal staff retention
  3. High office morale
  4. 20% G.M.

Essential Functions:

CUSTOMER

  • Interacting with customers on a regular basis to ensure satisfaction and gain useful feedback
  • Establish good working relationships with new customers
  • Resolving customer problems as needed
  • Managing daily operations, especially customer services and finance activities and make improvements as needed
  • Do whatever it takes to exceed the service expectations of our client

TEAM

  • Organizing and executing training programs for branch personnel
  • Evaluating employee performance and providing feedback and coaching as needed
  • Increase the overall productivity of the branch by implementing relevant employee training, eliminating inefficiencies and encouraging excellence in the work environment
  • Recognizing employee achievements and encouraging excellence in the work environment
  • Conducting regular sales and operations meetings
  • Briefing employees on current sales goals, promotions and other relevant information
  • Conduct one on one meetings with direct reports

BUSINESS

  • Organizing marketing activities and events for branch
  • Increasing brand awareness for company within the community
  • Complying with all applicable laws and regulations within the community
  • Increasing brand awareness for the company within the community
  • Complying with all applicable laws and regulations for the industry within your state
  • Assessing market conditions and identifying opportunities
  • Drafting forecasts and business plans
  • Managing budgets, allocating branch funds and defining financial objectives
  • Coordinating with other branches to share knowledge, plan promotional activities or achieve goals
  • Adhering to high ethical and professional standards
  • Identify, evaluate and manage strategic risks and opportunities
  • Developing and implementing sales plans

Secondary Responsibilities:

  • Ensure payroll is ran and complete each week
  • Assist with managing workers compensation and unemployment claims
  • Manage e-verification to ensure I9 compliance
  • Complete Employment verification forms as needed
  • Manage W.O.T.C.

item.title: Voice & Data Technicians and Installers
item.description:
Level I - Approximately 6-18 months of experience

 

Responsibilities:

  • Pulling and terminating Cat 3, 5e, 6 and 6a communications cabling.
  • Installing support structures such as J-hooks, bridle rings, ladder rack, and cable tray.
  • Basic blueprint reading

 

Level II – Approximately 18 months to 4 years of experience

 

Responsibilities:

  • Capable of performing all of the above-mentioned tasks in addition to identifying and labeling Cat 3, 5e and 6 cables,
  • Closet terminations (110 / 66 blocks and Patch Panels).
  • At least some exposure to fiber terminations
  • Low level and high-level testing and documentation,
  • Experience leading 3-10 other technicians on sight, documenting test results, troubleshooting, identifying cable paths and some abilities to perform site surveys.

 

Level III – Approximately 4 to 10 years of experience.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Capable of performing all of the tasks mentioned above in addition to performing Lead level responsibilities on crews ranging from 7-30 technicians.
  • Lead / Foreman level technicians who work in the field the majority of the time.
  • Higher end individuals will be capable of multiple project management, material management, staff management, scheduling, completing Gant charts, etc. Performing all terminations, testing and documentation on both copper and fiber optics are required.

item.title: Staffing Agency Recruiter/Business Development Manager
item.description:
Staffing Agency Recruiter/Business Development Manager

AtWork Personnel is hiring an experienced Staffing Agency Recruiter with a proven ability to convert client prospects into client partners. Salary + Commission DOE

Where You Excel - Recruiting Expertise

  • You manage the complete recruiting life cycle with grace, professionalism and urgency.
  • You revel in the rhythm of routine postings, screening applicants, and  interviewing the best and brightest Bay Area blue and white collar candidates.
  • You identify the right candidates for the right roles with confidence and integrity.
  • Your adherence to documentation and on-boarding processes ensures agency compliance and efficiency.

Where You Excel - Sales Expertise

  • Your positive disposition and warmth seemingly attracts the right client partners to the agency. You plan your day and work your plan to introduce AtWork Personnel to local business owners and hiring managers. Your strategies are effective with consistent results. You wear the badge of High Performer well having given 110% effort to the Sales process.
  • As you draft and present proposals to client prospects, you realize the fortune is in the follow up.
  • You hold yourself to the highest sales standards. Your company and personal sales goals reflect your competitive nature as well as your brand commitment.

Other duties include, but are not limited to:  

  • Maintain ongoing sales journal that accurately summarizes the status of outstanding proposals.
  • Participate in scheduled sales/recruiter meetings.
  • Amplify collective sales opportunities by introducing decision-makers and key client contacts to colleagues managers ?
  • Identify, research, analyze, and communicate competitive sales strategies.
  • Participate in key industry associations and events to increase awareness of the Company's brand and favorably position the Company to targeted clients within the community.
  • Demonstrate enthusiasm, initiative, teamwork, and professionalism.

Additional Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree
  • Minimum 3 years recruitment experience
  • Minimum 3 years sales experience
  • Demonstrated track record of closing sales
  • Outstanding written, verbal and presentation skills.
  • Excellent communication and relationship-building skills;
  • Proven competence with Microsoft Suite, Google Applications, recruiting platforms/tools and applicant tracking systems.
  • Neat, detail oriented appearance.
  • Must be willing to participate in and pass the company's pre-employment screening process including a background investigation, and drug screening.
  • Serve as a knowledgeable, personable ambassador of the company at conferences, career fairs, and other public-facing venues.
  • Build and maintain a strong network through industry contacts, association memberships, trade groups, and employees.

For immediate consideration, email resume to sf@atwork.com.

AtWork Personnel Company Profile

For over 25 years, AtWork Personnel Services has built upon its core foundation of meeting and exceeding the needs and expectations of job seekers and employers seeking a full-service partner to assist with their company’s staffing needs.

@WORK Personnel Services is a full service staffing supplier offering a broad variety of customized employment programs to fit the precise needs of each of our valued clients and employees. Such programs include traditional temporary labor, temp-to-hire personnel, payrolling, direct hire, and complete on-site services.

@WORK Personnel Services consists of independently owned franchise offices that each have the independent freedom to custom design specific staffing solutions for clients in their area. With additional regional, corporate and on-site facilities. @WORK Personnel Services has the experience and capability to create and manage the right staffing program for today’s fast moving companies.

AtWork Personnel Services is an EEO Employer. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Call AtWork San Francisco today. We’re always @WORK for You!

item.title: STAFFING ACCOUNT MANAGER
item.description:
Account Manager

Due to continued growth, Atwork Personnel Services is looking to hire a Staffing Account Manager. This Account Manager will be responsible for the sales process of short and long-term initiatives and staffing requirements by identifying and securing business opportunities and managing existing relationships with new and established clients.

Compensation

Paid per hour based on experience plus monthly commission.

Job Description

We are looking for a passionate Account Manager who will be a team player to ensure the long-term relationship with our customers and success of AtWork Personnel Services.

You will be responsible for the long-term relationship with our clients, connecting with Human Resource Managers, Department Managers, and key business executives. You will be a liaison between clients and Staffing Coordinators to ensure timely and successful solutions according to the client’s needs.

 

Responsibilities 

  • Research and source potential candidates through Internet searches and job boards.
  • Cold calling, whether being on the phone or going business to business.
  • Enter clients into data base and keeping needed notes on clients.
  • If needed, assist in reviewing applications and resumes to qualify potential candidates.
  • Interviewing potential candidates.
  • Call and set meetings with client’s key management and executives.
  • Conduct meeting with potential clients.
  • Develop and maintain a relationship with clients.
  • Assist in career fairs.
  • Identify and grow opportunities within the territory.

 

Requirements

  • Proven account management or other relevant experience.
  • Experience on delivering client staffing solutions based on client’s needs.
  • Proven ability to manage multiple projects at a time while paying attention to detail.
  • Excellent listening, negotiation and presentation skills.
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills.
  • Must be a self-starter, well organized, and reliable.

item.title: Aerospace Thermal Spray Masker
item.description:
Aerospace Thermal Spray Masker  / Second Shift (training on 1st)           

Monday to Friday

Workers in this position apply a variety of maskants to parts in preparation for the Thermal Spray process. The Thermal Spray Masker perform operations in accordance with Military and OEM specifications

Responsibilities

  • Utilize many different maskant techniques
  • Attention to quality of product
  • Know how to complete required paperwork
  • Review customer and  paperwork for instructions
  • Must follow technique card and instructions from more experienced maskers to process parts
  • Work closely with higher level operators to complete work and prioritize tasks
  • Sign off paperwork as required, Keep area clean and organized
  • Preparation of parts prior to operations
  • Use tooling and fixtures, when applicable
  • Prepare, understand, and documentation of technique card
  • Knowledge of pre and post cleaning surface finish requirements
  • Know how to avoid damaging material or equipment
  • Be familiar with Quality Assurance requirements & rework procedures
  • Be familiar with engineering drawing notations
  • Be familiar with the safety precautions & know how to avoid injury to personnel
  • Actively participate in continuous improvement activities to drive positive change in productivity, delivery, and service
item.job:requirements:
Qualifications

  • Must be a US Person and able to provide proof of US Person status upon hiring
  • Ability to train others, Ability to write technique cards  
  • Excellent accuracy with a strong attention to detail and demonstrated teamwork attitude
  • Ability to multi task effectively, Ability to communicate well.

item.title: Forklift Operator
item.description:
Shipping/Receiving (Propane Hilo experience REQUIRED)

Forklift Operators will be required to use standard diesel of propane powered forklifts or telescopic forklifts primarily assigned to unload materials and supplies necessary for the plant operation; move palletized bagged materials from a conveyor line to the storage yard; load both flatbed and box trucks for shipping using either portable loading ramps or operating off the ground.

  • Work safely and responsibly and follow all safety policies and procedures
  • Perform daily equipment checks and minor service maintenance
  • Moving palatalized materials throughout the storage facility
  • Installs and re-supplies as necessary rolls of bagging film, rolls of stretch wrap, top sheet, pallets, bottom sheet, labels, and other consumables as needed.
  • Follow shipping instructions and load trucks with proper materials to complete orders
  • Move & stack pallets in the correct storage areas
  • Lift and carry boards between pallets while stacking
  • Align pallet stacks vertically and safely
  • Ensure bags are not damaged during pallet handling
  • Examine bag products to verify conformance to quality standards
  • Perform work according to accepted procedures and practices
  • Change out propane tanks or fill with diesel fuel depending on the type of forklift
  • Keep accurate records of production data
  • Communicate all concerns affecting safety, quality, productivity and the work environment to the Supervisor
  • Other work as required and assigned

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Must have forklift experience
  • High degree of attention required to prevent injury to self and co workers; promote a safe workplace
  • Must be able to wear steel-toed shoes and safety glasses
  • Must be able to speak, comprehend, and read English
  • Must be able to work safely in varying temperatures in production/warehouse workplace and outside year round
  • Must be able to lift and carry 20-25 pounds regularly
  • Must be able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds occasionally

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $13.25 to $14.00 /hour

 

Job Type: Full-time
item.job:additionalinfo: F or immediate consideration call 586 204-2136 and send resume to warren@atwork.com

item.title: 2nd Shift Line Leader
item.description:
Position: Team Leader

Industry: Automotive

Job Type: Full Time/Permanent

Shift: 2ND 430 PM - 3 AM (sometimes 5 AM)

Location: Sterling Heights MI

Compensation: 14.50/hour

Job Summary

Supervises the activities of production personnel engaged in all facets of the manufacturing function. A level I supervisor is considered a working supervisor with little authority for personnel actions. May require a bachelor's degree in area of specialty. Familiar with a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures. Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected. Typically reports to a manager or head of a unit/department.

Job Description

Duties & Responsibilities Information:

  • Ensures workstations meet all safety, 1+5S and TPM requirements by being actively involved with the assessment of all workstations per Quality and 1+5S guidelines
  • Reviews all Method Sheets that apply to work performed within the department and facilitates training of all employees per proper Method Sheets and Training Procedures with HR
  • Facilitates proper scanning of work orders within the Oracle Production System to ensure accurate production reporting and inventory; ensures all rework tickets are filled out and turned in to the proper department
  • Influences team members by displaying a positive proactive work ethic that sets the standards for maintaining a safe, productive work environment while setting and maintaining high quality standards and striving for continuous improvement
  • Functions as a working production team member as needed
  • Maintains First5 Boards and conducts First5 Meeting in Supervisors absence
  • Facilitates and helps maintain all lean enterprise initiatives, 1+5S, TPM, VSM requirements
  • Signs off on all completed department outbound production prior to movement to the next level of production
  • Performs other duties as assigned by Supervisor or Team Leader

Necessary Skills:

  • Demonstrated leadership ability

Notes : Must have five years of hands on industrial manufacturing, experience, preferably in rotating equipment applications

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $14.50/hour

item.title: Recruitment Coodinator
item.description:
Are you a people person, but not looking to be in retail store environment?   Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment?   

Are you an accomplished “Stay at home Mom” looking to stay challenged with a role that fits into your schedule?

If you answered yes to these questions, we may have an excellent opportunity for you!

 Part-Time Professional Role in N. Raleigh

  • $11 -$12/hr.
  • 20-25 hours/week
  • Mon-Fri 9:30am-2:30pm

The Recruitment Coordinator (RC) works closely with recruiters in a fast-paced recruiting organization. The (RC) plays an integral role in managing recruiting activities and building candidate relationships; often providing candidates with their first impression of @WORK Personnel.

This person will be an organizational guru, work effectively with internal and external clients and candidates, possess great communication skills, have the ability to shift gears at a moment’s notice and enjoy the challenges of helping to build a great organization of talented individuals.

Responsibilities:
• Scheduling interviews and performing phone screens with candidates applying for open positions
• Updating candidate records and job postings in recruiting systems and confirming new hires
• Providing follow-up correspondence to candidates on recruiting status via phone, text, and email
• On-boarding employees, uploading paperwork, creating employees in our systems, and performing e-verify
• Identifying opportunities for improving candidate experience and scheduling efficiency
• Assisting in the coordination of other recruiting activities as needed
item.job:requirements:
• Superb customer focus, attention to detail and organization skills
    • Strong oral and written communication skills
    • 3+ years working in a fast paced, quickly changing professional environment
    • Experience with MS Word, Excel and Power Point, Google Docs
    • Bachelor of Science Degree Preferred

@WORK Personnel is an Equal Opportunity Employer - All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other factor determined to be unlawful under applicable law.

item.title: Project Support Coordinator
item.description:
Job Title: Coordinator

Location: Auburn Hills MI

Compensation: 35-45k annually

 

Project Coordinator – FCA TSB Support

 

Summary/Objective: This position is responsible for project support of the FCA TSB activities that are conducted onsite at FCA in Auburn Hills, MI.  These aspects include, but are not limited to, all general operational tasks and operational support for the FCA TSB Authoring Team.

 

Essential Functions: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  (Please list all essential functions for the position.)

  1. Global Field Service Action Document Development (SB/RRT)
    1. Monitor and analyze KPI results for target achievement and performance
    2. Report out of monthly KPI data for Service Action Development
    3. Maintain and adjust KPI documents due to changing business requirements
    4. Documentation of process changes
    5. Maintain and adjust Training Documentation
    6. Administrate, support and train new user of the GFSAR system
    7. Track and monitor document translations for timing, quality, quantity and quotation from supplier
    8. CMS approver for TSO

 

Other Job Functions: Support and engage in project process discussion other than GFSAR. This includes KPI collection and report out, documentation of process changes and training material.

Supervisor Responsibilities: N/A

Work Environment: This job operates in a professional office environment setting.  This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets, and fax machines. (This will vary by department.)

Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to…..

Position Type: Some flexibility in hours is allowed, but the employee must be available during the core work hours of 8:00 am to 4:00 pm and must work 40 hours each week. (This will vary by department)

Travel: Less than 10% domestic and international travel may be required.

Required Education/Experience: Associates degree in related field or equivalent professional experience in administrative responsibilities and office management preferred.  Approximately 1 to 3 years of related experience preferred with a minimum of 2 years’ experience using Microsoft Office Applications, i.e. Word, Excel, PowerPoint.

 

Classification: Non-Exempt

Reports To: Manager, FCA Content Development

Additional Eligibility Qualifications:

  1. Experience working collaboratively with client service teams in fast paced environment. Ability to dialog freely with internal teams
  2. Excellent written and oral communications skills
  3. Exceptional attention to detail and thorough approach to follow-through on all tasks
  4. Ability to work under pressure and prioritize tasks to ensure efficiencies
  5. Ability to multitask and interface with many personalities
  6. Solid understanding of basic computer skills, experience in Excel, Adobe Acrobat Microsoft Outlook or equivalent email package
  7. Enthusiastic, reliable, personable, positive attitude and well organized
  8. Ability to engender trust

 

Disclaimer: This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee.  Other duties, responsibilities, and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice.

item.title: Wiring Specialist
item.description:
Job title:  Data Specialist - Tracer

Department: Wiring

Type: Full Time/Permanent

Compensation: 50-65k

Summary/Objective:

This position is responsible for data mining, creating and validating OEM vehicle wiring harness and DTC information from various types of engineering source information for the automotive industry. These aspects included but not limited to source data integrity and error reporting to the OEM, maintaining key source data contacts, manage source data changes that effect product output, maintain the communication of the source data and related changes to internal development SMEs, validate end product prior to production release and input to internal Q&A reporting and escalation. The content may come in multiple formats and may involve interfacing with multiple clients, both internal and external. Regardless of deliverable or style, this position must ensure timely and accurate completion of tasks while maintaining compliance to both corporate and customer standards.

Essential Functions:

  1. Responsible for gathering, tracking, delivering and validating all relevant source date required to develop the Tracer product.
  2. Understand and Use OEM engineering source information systems/repositories to coordinate the development of Tracer with the all areas relevant. Creative, Production Development Engineering and Content.
  3. Coordinate with both onsite and offsite SME’s to ensure all information is included for each targeted production release to ensure 100% complete, accurate and on-time metric.
  4. Working with OEM engineering and suppliers to provide accurate and up to date DTC & wiring harness information.
  5. Provide all updated project source data inputs to the responsible SME for all development of final output files/graphics relating to project schedules and Launch Cadence plans.
  6. Follow current procedures and processes as necessary to ensure deliverable meets or exceeds client expectations.
  1. Document open issues and follow through on resolution and inclusion.
  2. Complete assignments to support existing business and new business; including new products and services.
  3. Provide updated project files/graphics relating to project schedules, and project changes.
  4. Develop and maintain strong client relationships with the engineering organizations.
  5. Follow-up on all client feedback. Ensure all client revisions are incorporated and distributed to the teams for action.

 

Other Job Functions:

  1. Ability to understand Creative, Product Development Engineering, OEM Plant, OEM source gathering and validation processes that are key to the success of the product output.
  2. Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Outlook, or equivalent email package.
  3. Ability to dialog freely with internal teams about projects to ensure solutions are well planned.
  4. Excellent written and oral communications skills.
  5. Exceptional attention to detail and thorough approach to follow-through on all tasks.
  6. Ability to work under pressure and prioritize tasks to ensure efficiencies.
  7. Ability to multitask and interface with many personalities.
  8. Enthusiastic and well organized. Successful at maintaining schedules and raising issues as necessary.
  9. Envision, Plan and Manage time/workload to ensure successful delivery of projects.
  10. Ability to work with domestic and international business cultures.

 

 

Supervisor Responsibilities: No

Work Environment: This job operates in a professional office environment setting.  This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets, and fax machines.

Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to, operate in and around cars, trucks and vans doing technician like duties including diagnosis and repair.  Moderate lifting (less than 40 lbs) will be required.  Most will be diagnostic testing routines and desk work development.

Position Type:   Some flexibility in hours is allowed, but the employee must be available during the core work hours of 9:00 am to 3:00 pm and must work 40 hours each week.

Travel: 10% to 15% Domestic and international travel may be required.

Required Education/Experience: BA/BS or equivalent professional experience in electrical diagnostic and wiring content development preferred. Approximately 5 years of direct service & diagnostic/wiring information development required. Industry Standard certifications preferred.  In-depth OEM knowledge a plus.

 

Classification: Exempt

Reports To: Executive Director – Content Development (Until Manager is Selected)

Additional Eligibility Qualifications: Valid Driver's License

Disclaimer:         This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee.  Other duties, responsibilities, and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice.

item.description:

Industry: Automotive

Department : Owners Manuals

Type: Full Time/Permanent 

Compensation: 45-55k per year

Owner Information Technical Author – Content Development

Summary/Objective:     This Technical Author position is responsible for the development and production of automotive owner information related materials for various publication types and deliveries. These aspects include researching OEM design and release documents, product development documents, plant installation drawings, parts detail drawings, technical service bulletins, CAD/CATIA data, and hands-on procedures utilizing prototype vehicles to develop efficient, concise, and technically accurate owner information for our OEM clients. 

Development may be in multiple formats (including web based) and may involve interface with multiple clients both internal and external. Regardless of deliverable or style, this position must ensure timely and accurate completion of tasks which maintain compliance to both corporate and customer standards.

item.title: Access Control Clerk
item.description:
AtWork Personnel - Irondale is seeking detail orientated and directive driven candidates for an Access Control Clerk position with a local hospital.

 

Access Control Clerk:

An access control clerk is a multifaceted data entry position in support of the parking and security program. Candidates should be proficient in database entry and microsoft office programs. Ideal candidates will have strong multi-tasking abilities, able to work under deadlines, have a strong customer service demeanor, systematic and should be directive driven.

Daily Job Duties

Manage daily access control requests from health system admin, managers and associates who submit requests.

Manage daily parking access requests from tenant staff, health system staff and vendors.

Print ID badges and enter on boarding contingent associates into the AMAG database.

Act as a liaison between medical affairs and security; assisting with access requests and new badge requests for physician staff.

Manage master vehicle index for the Birmingham campus (enter car information)

Ticket input, and ticket output in Security’s CAD system.

Route technical issues to security technician.

Other administrative assignments as instructed.

 

 

*PLEASE CLICK THE LINK BELOW TO COMPLETE APPLICATION*

item.title: Auto Processor (TWIC Required)
item.description:
HR Administrative Assistant/Sourcer

AtWork Personnel is now hiring for an HR Administrative Assistant. You are an excellent candidate for this role because you love embracing others with your warm, and friendly personality. You enjoy the upbeat and fast pace of a busy and productive office. It’s where you showcase your best skills.

Where You Excel:

  • Greeting visitors is not a chore, you actually LOVE IT! Your days are complete and fulfilled when you have satisfied the needs of our external customers and internal teams. There’s a picture of your smiling face next to the word friendly in the dictionary.
  • You are a self-starter. You take the initiative and anticipate the needs of others.
  • You are articulate and have excellent verbal and written communication.
  • Visitors speak highly of your professional attire, etiquette, and contagious energy.
  • You operate a switchboard with professionalism and grace.
  • Sourcing talent and scheduling interviews is effortless because of your keen eye for identifying the right talent for the right role.
  • Your administrative proficiencies foster confidence from your coworkers, managers and customers. You’re more than an HR Administrative Assistant. You are the missing piece that completes our puzzle and we can’t wait to welcome you to our team.

This is an excellent opportunity to expand your administrative skills with a growing staffing firm! As an HR Administrative Assistant, you will be responsible for many office duties including, but not limited to:  

PRIMARY DUTIES:

  • Operating a switchboard to route incoming calls and to place outgoing calls.
  • Sourcing talent from applicant tracking systems and job boards.
  • Weekly processing of payroll (Typically takes 2 days to process)
  • Scheduling interviews for recruiting teams.
  • Receiving/Processing/Distributing Incoming mail
  • Data Entry/Creating Spreadsheets in Google Docs
  • Creating spreadsheets, tables, documents
  • Maintaining fax machines
  • Light filing

Additional Requirements:

Performing multiple tasks with competing deadlines requires an exceptional personality, patience, a genuine desire to support others, and at least 2-3 years of concentrated experience. In this role you will have little to no supervision and will be expected to know and follow general clerical procedures and protocol. Are you equipped for this challenge? Apply today!
item.job:additionalinfo:
AtWork Personnel Company Profile

For over 25 years AtWork has exceeded the needs and expectations of clients and job seekers by staying committed to our mission: To be AtWork for You. This service-focused approach has fueled our growth from 11 offices in 1992 to nearly 100 offices in 26 states, and counting.

@WORK Personnel Services is a full service staffing supplier offering a broad variety of customized employment programs to fit the precise needs of each of our valued clients and employees. Such programs include traditional temporary labor, temp-to-hire personnel, payrolling, direct hire, and complete on-site services.

@WORK Personnel Services consists of independently owned franchise offices that each have the independent freedom to custom design specific staffing solutions for clients in their area. With additional regional, corporate and on-site facilities. @WORK Personnel Services has the experience and capability to create and manage the right staffing program for today’s fast moving companies.

AtWork Personnel Services is an EEO Employer. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Call AtWork San Francisco today. We’re always @WORK for You!

Job Type: Full-time

Salary commensurable with experience.

item.title: Billing Trainee
item.description:
A well known and renowned trucking company is looking for a Billing Specialist/Trainee. Great way to get your foot in the door and become hired with a company based upon your work performance. If you were to become hired with this company you will be offered an excellent health benefit package as well as a 401K. Apply today at atwork.com/Columbia or email your resume with attention to Michael Miller at: mmiller@atwork.com

 

The Billing Trainee’s primary responsibility is to learn to accurately transfer information from the customer’s bill of lading document into the billing system in an efficient and timely manner. Once classroom training is completed, Billing Trainees have a 90 day period over which to meet and maintain the minimum acceptable performance levels.  During this time bills for each shift are divided among Billing Specialists and Billing Trainees, and all bills for the entire shift must be completed before the shift ends.  Accordingly, when a Billing Trainee has completed transferring the bills for which the employee is initially responsible each shift, the employee will be required to assist with any other bills, assigned to other employees or not, that need to be transferred to complete the shift’s work.  As such, shifts will often end at different times, exceed 9 hours, and overtime is mandatory when needed.  Given the time sensitive nature of completing all of a shift’s work, and the requirement to maintain minimum acceptable performance levels within 90 days of initial training, employee attendance, both daily and throughout each shift, is critical to avoid undue hardship to other employees and disruption of normal business operations. 

 

  • Progresses toward quality standards of 90% and progresses to at least 35 quality bills per hour within 90 days of initial training.
  • Regular attendance for duration of shift.
  • Maintains accurate records of customer billing requirements along with a working knowledge of the customer master file.
  • Participates in the team/department related initiatives designed to improve customer service and the work environment in general.
  • Maintains a thorough working knowledge of the Freight Bill Entry Manual and participates in periodic evaluations for the purpose of enhancement.
  • Other duties as assigned by management.
item.job:requirements:
• Successful completion of the Freight Bill Entry training program required.
  • High School diploma or equivalent required.
  • Ability to pay strong attention to detail
  • Professional demeanor (appearance and behavior)
  • Familiarity with basic personal computer operations required

item.title: Batching
item.description:
AtWork is now accepting resumes for Batching. The Batcher is responsible for preparing and mixing of appropriate ingredients required to produce finished syrup from calculation for bottling, canning, and premix/post-mix operations based upon number of cases and tanks scheduled for production each shift. This position is a long term temporary position with the possibility of going full time with our client. It also requires 24 hour flexibility.

Position Responsibilities

  • Control flow of syrup to production lines.
  • Mix and blend ingredients to create various batches.
  • Set equipment parameters for operation.
  • Perform quality checks as required.
  • Perform sanitation.
  • Inventory and control ingredients.
  • Receive, monitor and control sugar.
  • Maintain records.
  • Operate forklift truck.
  • Follow all policies and procedures, including Safety.

Qualifications

  • Previous experience batching, mixing, or compounding
  • Can lift, push, and pull 50 pounds repeatedly during the duration of your shift in a full range motion
  • Can stand, kneel, twist, bend throughout the duration of your shift
  • Previously worked in a related industry (Pharmaceuticals, Chemical, Cosmetic, Food or Beverage, Military)
  • Previous experience reading and following recipe details
  • Previous experience with an application system such as SAP that used for electronic documentation

Don't miss out on this great opportunity! Apply today for immediate consideration!

In this role, you will be working in a warehouse/production environment that does handle chemicals, smells, and hazardous materials.

item.description:
AtWork assisting our client, located in the Sacramento area, who is seeking a Sanitation Technician to join their team. This is a long term temporary position with the possibility of going full time with our client. The hours for the shift are from 9:00pm to 5:30am, 3rd shift, Monday - Friday. Must be flexible to work overtime and weekends depending on the needs of the business.

 

The Sanitation Technician maintains the cleanliness of the production floor.

  • Maintain orderly and clean work area in compliance with the company's safety and sanitation requirements.
  • Possess understanding of production equipment so it can be properly cleaned and operated. 
  • Use of cleaning chemicals and safe handling practices.

item.description:
Position: Team Leader

Industry: Automotive

Job Type: Full Time/Permanent

Shift: 3RD  12AM-8AM

Location: Sterling Heights MI

Compensation: 12.25

Job Summary

Supervises the activities of production personnel engaged in all facets of the manufacturing function. A level I supervisor is considered a working supervisor with little authority for personnel actions. May require a bachelor's degree in area of specialty. Familiar with a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures. Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected. Typically reports to a manager or head of a unit/department.

Job Description

Duties & Responsibilities Information:

  • Ensures workstations meet all safety, 1+5S and TPM requirements by being actively involved with the assessment of all workstations per Quality and 1+5S guidelines
  • Reviews all Method Sheets that apply to work performed within the department and facilitates training of all employees per proper Method Sheets and Training Procedures with HR
  • Facilitates proper scanning of work orders within the Oracle Production System to ensure accurate production reporting and inventory; ensures all rework tickets are filled out and turned in to the proper department
  • Influences team members by displaying a positive proactive work ethic that sets the standards for maintaining a safe, productive work environment while setting and maintaining high quality standards and striving for continuous improvement
  • Functions as a working production team member as needed
  • Maintains First5 Boards and conducts First5 Meeting in Supervisors absence
  • Facilitates and helps maintain all lean enterprise initiatives, 1+5S, TPM, VSM requirements
  • Signs off on all completed department outbound production prior to movement to the next level of production
  • Performs other duties as assigned by Supervisor or Team Leader

Necessary Skills:

  • Demonstrated leadership ability

Notes : Must have five years of hands on industrial manufacturing, experience, preferably in rotating equipment applications

item.title: Staffing Coordinator/Recruiter Associate
item.description:
About AtWork Personnel Services

Atwork is a national staffing firm headquartered in Knoxville TN, currently expanding in Roseville CA.  The @WORK Group is a leader in the staffing industry, with 100 offices nationwide and growing.  Awarded Top US Staffing firm and Best of Staffing by Inaverno/CareerBuilder, five years in a row.  AtWork Personnel Services of Roseville have a strong culture of promoting from within; this isn’t just a job – it’s a career!  We are a nationwide company with a local owner who is always ready to hear your ideas and feedback, we encourage team members to show us what they’ve got and back them up for success. AtWork is a great place to work!

Job Description
Staffing Coordinator is the first impression for all applicants and customers!  Responsibility includes processing all new hire paperwork for applicants, answering phones, and assisting with clerical and administrative support to our sales and recruiters.  Staffing Coordinator will also assist our Senior Recruiters to find and place candidates utilizing internet recruiting sources and schedule interviews.  We have outstanding training and mentorship programs!  If you have recruiting experience or have always wanted to move into recruiting role, this position is perfect for you!   

 

Primary Responsibilities

Admin/Office Manager duties:

  • Answering multi-line phones and taking messages
  • Greeting all Visitors and Applicants
  • Clerical duties such as filing, data entry, and processing applications
  • Light cleaning of office & break room
  • Sorting and paying bills
  • Administrative support to a team of recruiters and sales, not limited to organize activities, taking appointments, job fair, special projects, etc.

 Recruiting duties:

  • Inputting hiring information in our database/system
  • Filing hiring paperwork
  • Screening potential candidates (online search, phone interview, etc)
  • Administering drug test and background check
  • Onboarding and employee orientation

 

Job Qualifications

  • Minimum of 1 year of office, clerical, or administrative support experience
  • Recruiting experience is a plus
  • Assertive, outgoing personality
  • Excellent written and verbal skills.
  • Very detailed oriented
  • Able to perform effectively in a very fast pace environment
  • Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision.
  • Must possess excellent organizational and time management skills.
  • Professional presentation and demeanor
  • Superior customer service skills
  • Bilingual Spanish is a plus

 Pay is $14 - $17 per hour, commensurate experience.  If you are interested in this fantastic opportunity and have the skills and qualifications listed above, give us a call at 916-791-3000!

item.title: Food Industry Project Manager
item.description:
Project Manager

This position will be responsible for developing and leading key performance improvement projects across the entire organization including production, supply chain, quality, sanitation, maintenance, purchasing and information systems. Reporting to the plant manager the position will include work at two facilities.

  • Review production schedules, engineering specifications, process flows, and other information to understand methods and activities in manufacturing and services
  • Figure out how to manufacture parts or products, or deliver services, with maximum efficiency
  • Develop management control systems to make financial planning and cost analysis more efficient
  • Develop standards and specifications to support company and project needs
  • Utilize process mapping, data collection and analysis to arrive at viable solutions to issues
  • Enact quality control procedures to resolve production problems or minimize costs
  • Work with customers and management to develop standards for design and production
  • Design control systems to coordinate activities and production planning to ensure that products meet quality standards
  • Confer with vendors and internal customers about product specifications, purchases, manufacturing capabilities, and staff about the design, needs and status of projects
  • Develop project plans including objective, current status, gap analysis, tasks, owners, timeline and financial impacts
  • Experience with improvement tools and techniques including statistics, financial modeling, lean and six sigma.

Prior experience in:

  • Industrial food manufacturing
  • Project management
  • Information systems including ERP, MES, Shop Floor systems
  • Knowledge of production processes, costs, quality control, raw materials and other methods for maximizing the efficient manufacture and distribution of goods.
  • Interpreting precision technical plans, blueprints, drawings and models.
  • Advanced skills in MS applications
  • S. degree in industrial engineering, mechanical engineering or industrial technology.
  • Minimum 5 years of experience

item.title: 3rd Shift Industrial Food Maintenance Mechanic
item.description:
Job Summary

3rd Shift Industrial Maintenance Technician job opportunity with fantastic, food manufacturing plant. Great benefits and incentives. Must have experience working in a Manufacturing Plant.

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/EXPERIENCE :

GENERAL KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS

  • Must be able to demonstrate mechanical ability and skills and carry out daily maintenance activities, plant rounds, preventative maintenance, plant calls and continual improvement assignments.
  • Must have general maintenance troubleshooting skills and equipment component knowledge to properly diagnose equipment failures.
  • Must understand proper lubrication practices of bearings, chains, and gearboxes.
  • Must be capable of using all shop and hand tools and equipment in a safe and proper manner
  • Must be able to perform all assigned equipment service in a professional manner and follow instructions.
  • Must be able to follow, understand and utilize work logs, breakdown reports, work orders and preventive maintenance logs.

ELECTRICAL SKILLS

  • Must meet or exceed the following electrical requirements
  • Demonstrate the ability to use a voltmeter properly to identify voltage, amperage and resistance of an electrical circuit.
  • Demonstrate the ability to read and utilize electrical schematics to diagnose electrical problems.
  • Demonstrate ability to properly electrically disconnect and reconnect DC, AC, motion control and Wye-Delta Motors.

MECHANICAL SKILLS

  • Able to distinguish and identify chain, sprockets, gearbox types and belts.
  • Able to identify shaft sizes and material of construction.
  • Able to identify and distinguish bolts and nuts sizes, applications and material of construction.
  • Able to identify basic equipment parts and components for job assignments.
  • Capable of tracking product conveyor belts
  • Perform effective preventive maintenance on equipment with minimal supervision.

WELDING

  • Demonstrate basic ability to weld metal, stick, or Heliarc.
  • Demonstrate the ability to perform basic copper soldering
  • Demonstrate the proper use of oxy/acetylene torch in cutting and brazing.

REFRIGERATION

  • Demonstrate basic refrigeration comprehension and understanding of refrigeration fundamentals, components and their functions.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS:

  • Maintains good attendance and punctuality. Follows established work schedule.
  • Must have excellent communication skills both oral and written.
  • Maintain a positive and respectful attitude; cooperate with co-workers, management, internal and external customers, as applicable. Reports any incidents of harassment to his Supervisor or Human Resources Manager.
  • Must be able to take direction and follow instructions.
  • Must work safely at all times and report any unsafe conditions or injuries to his Supervisor or Safety Manager immediately.

Must be willing to comply with other duties, assigned by direct supervisors.

MINIMUM REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS, EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE :

  • 5 years’ experience working with industrial equipment
  • High School Graduate or GED
  • Must be able to provide personnel tools to perform all assigned maintenance tasks
  • Must be willing to work flexible hours.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

  • Must be able to regularly lift and or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and or move 50 pounds.
  • Must be able to work on ladders, scissor lifts, scaffolding and other high precarious places safely and effectively.
  • Must be able to work around electrical, mechanical, hydraulic, pneumatic and thermodynamic equipment safely.

item.title: CNC Machinist Setup/Operator (Temp-Hire)
item.description:
Job Description
CNC Machinist needed for Plug & Pin Gage manufacturing company in Santa Ana.

Hours: Monday-Friday- 6am-2:30pm

Temp-Hire Job Opportunity

Job Description

  • Edits programs for CNC vertical, horizontal mills, lathe, transmit programs from DNC to machine control and back to the DNC, including zero and reference points; setting tool registers, offsets, compensation, and conditional switches; calculating requirements, including basic math, and proving out part programs.
  • Sets-up mills and lathes by installing and adjusting three- and four-jaw chucks, tools, attachments, collets, bushings, cams, gears, stops, and stock pushers; indicating vices; tramming heads.
  • Loads feed mechanism by lifting stock into position.
  • Ability to measure using inspection tools, such as Micrometer, Height gage, O.D Micrometer, Comparator, Calipers, and experience checking first article / first-run part, and sample workpieces, and adhering to all geometric symbols and standards.
  • Maintains specifications by observing drilling, grooving, and cutting, including turning, facing, knurling and thread chasing operations; taking measurements; detecting malfunctions; troubleshooting processes; adjusting and reprogramming controls; sharpening and replacing worn tools; adhering to quality assurance procedures and processes.
  • Maintains safe operations by adhering to safety procedures and regulations.
  • Maintains equipment by completing preventive maintenance requirements; following manufacturer's instructions; troubleshooting malfunctions; calling for repairs.
  • Clocking in and out of work order operations, and documenting actions by completing production and quality logs.
  • Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities reading technical publications.
  • Accomplishes organization goals by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests, and exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.

Requirements:

  • Basic math skills.
  • Basic blue print reading and interpretation.
  • Operate various machines to perform specific operations.
  • Ability to learn set-ups and operate machine.
  • Handling of customer hardware using proper inspecting tools and methods.
  • Read, understand, and check job routers for accuracy.
  • Detects and reports defective materials or questionable conditions to the department supervisor.
  • Maintains safety by keeping the work area and equipment in a clean orderly condition and follows prescribed safety regulations.

item.title: Transportation Coordinator
item.description:
This role is responsible for enabling an efficient day-to-day transportation operations through route staffing, dealing with LTL trucking companies, and finding the ideal balance between service and cost.  This is a new position because our business demands an in house person to fit our growing customer base. 100% of family health insurance paid.

Essential Function :

  • Frequent communication with Management team regarding status and logistics of deliveries/pick ups to ensure quality service is provided to our customers.
  • Ensure all deliveries/pick ups are done efficiently, specific customer requests or concerns are communicated clearly
  • Ensure adherence to all security and operational procedure
Requirements:
  • A High School Degree is required.
  • 1+ years experience in a transportation-related lead or dispatching role.
  • Customer processing, route delivery procedures and basic security and operational procedures.
  • Familiar with DOT requirements.
  • Prior experience in a similar role
  • Dispatching a plus
 
The ideal applicant will have current exp. in transportation-related lead or dispatching role. At this time we are considering only local candidates who are able to work without employer sponsorship. Only those candidates whose experience best meets our requirements will be contacted.
