item.title: Tower Crew Foreman
item.description:
AtWork Personnel - Irondale is seeking experienced candidates for a Tower Crew Foreman position with a local Telecommunications Company. This is a Direct Hire placement, and an immediate need! 

The pay is $18-$30 an hour based on experience with potential for overtime! 

SUMMARY: The Tower Crew Foreman must have an expert level of understanding with all aspects of the Wireless Industry. The person in this position will be expected to maintain full control of their crew’s production and lead by example. They will utilize the tower lead to develop and plan out the complete build of the site. This person will verify a high quality of deliverables for SOW and will identify change orders, possible obstacles and safety concerns which may prevent timely completion of site work.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

The following reflects management’s definition of essential functions for this job but does not restrict the tasks that may be assigned. Management may assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons.

Must have an emphasis and higher understanding of:

  • Capstan operations, Crane/signaling, Rigging, Steal work (hanging boom, antenna etc.) and shoot azimuths. (Front, Back and Side)
  • Understand full quality and safety procedures.
  • Developed management skills in running their team in day to day operations.
  • Expert in reading CD’s/ Blue prints, RFDS etc.
  • Expert in FULL COP process including photos, forms, etc.
  • Expert level of knowledge with testing equipment –Anritsu, Fiber tester, PIM, RET etc.
  • Foreman will be responsible for COP deliverables to the COP team.
  • Foreman will be responsible for production reporting, hours, time off, new/damaged equipment needs etc. to the management team.
  • All crew tools equipment and vehicles are expected to be cared for as part of a daily process.
  • Submit all required daily and weekly paperwork. (JSA, Weekly safety topics, crane/heavy machinery forms etc.)

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Minimum 1 Year Tower and Telecommunications Experience Required
  • Technical Understanding/Ability
  • Desire to Succeed and Learn New Skills.
  • Commitment to excellence and high standards.
  • Strong organizational skills; able to manage priorities and workflow.
  • Ability to work independently and as a member of various teams.
  • Acute attention to detail
  • Good judgment with the ability to make timely and sound decisions
  • Versatility, flexibility, and a willingness to work within constantly changing priorities with enthusiasm.

item.title: Electro-Mechanical Assemblers NEEDED in Hemet ASAP!
item.description:
We have a new opening for an Electro-mechanical Assemblers in Hemet!!! Temp to Hire! 

  1. Summary of Position:
  • Performs repetitive mechanical assembly of simple electromechanical assemblies, subassemblies, mechanisms and systems in accordance with production/engineering specifications, sketches and/or verbal instructions. 
  1. Key Responsibilities / Essential Functions:
  • Performs repetitive mechanical assembly of simple electromechanical assemblies, subassemblies, mechanisms and systems in accordance with production/engineering specifications, sketches and/or verbal instructions.
  • Performs assembly work requiring a high degree of manual dexterity.
  • Uses tools and fixtures for precise locating and positioning of parts.
  • Adjusts, aligns, and tightens using an air vise, hand tools, pneumatic tools, and drill presses.  Drill presses currently only used in the WS Assembly line.
  • Keeps track of inventory in work area, and notifies supervisor when material is needed.
  • Identifies and replaces or reports defective subassemblies.
  • Conducts simple go-no-go testing.
  • Observes and complies with all safety regulations and company policies.
  • Other Responsibilities and Functions:
  • Observes and complies with all safety regulations and company policies.
  • Maintains clean, orderly, and safe work area.
  • Maintains a commitment to teamwork and a positive, supportive attitude to all personnel.
  • Performs other duties as assigned to insure the success of projects, individuals, and the company.
  • Supports continuous improvement activities (DBS).
  1. Education and Experience:
  • High School or equivalent.
  1. Skills and Competencies:
  • Knowledge of basic assembly processes.
  • Ability to read and understand verbal and written instructions, specifications, blueprints or sketches.
  • Self-motivated, self-starter, sense of urgency, personable, energetic, dependable, honest, and thorough.
  • Quality conscious with the ability to meet productivity goals.
  • Excellent communication skills including excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Detail-oriented and able to maintain a high level of ownership and accuracy on all work activities.
  • Ability to work in a positive manner with other associates within cell areas and develop and maintain. strong working relationships across teams and disciplines.
  • Can adapt and operate within a high-performance culture.
  1. Work Environment:
  • The work environment consists of an indoor industrial work environment with good ventilation, adequate lighting, and low noise levels.
  • Physical Demands:
  • The physical demands described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions

item.title: Counter Sales Representative
item.description:
AtWork Personnel Service is currently looking for a counter sales representative/assembler in the Orlando, FL area. If you have experience and are looking for a full time position with a great company apply today.

Responsibilities:

  • Assist customers with orders and locate products in the warehouse
  • Must be able to understand the common parts and pieces of the hose and fitting industry
  • Must be able to handle cash and be responsible for making change and balancing bank of branch
  • Must have passed or in the process of taking NAHAD Hose Safety Institute Industrial & Hydraulic Exams
  • Keep Inventory organized and have correct counts on a regular basis and stock retail shelves and bins
  • Responsible for keeping branch retail area, break room and bath rooms clean at all times
  • Responsible for waiting on customers and fabricating hose
  • Open and close the facility as necessary

Requirements:

  • Previous counter sales experience (example: parts store front counter)
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Must be able to fabricate and weld/braze hose assemblies
  • Must be able to read and precisely interpret tape measure and analyze digital calipers
  • Must be able to read, write and comprehend English (Bilingual in Spanish is preferred)
  • Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment
  • Be a collaborative problem solver with strong math skills, fractions and calculate percentages
  • Excellent attention to detail, strong analytical and organizational skills required
  • Basic computer skills (email, and Microsoft Office)

item.title: Junior Service Technician
item.description:
We are looking for a self-starter Field service technician for our client in Medley, Florida  to deliver the desired customer service experience. The goal is to drive service success that improves customer satisfaction, maximizes customer retention and increases profitability.

 

Responsibilities and Duties

The Elevator Apprentice must possess at least one of the following:

  • Provide service and customer support during field visits or dispatches
  • Tie workflow to schedule
  • Manage all on site installation, repair, maintenance and test tasks
  • Diagnose errors or technical problems and determine proper solutions
  • Produce timely and detailed service reports
  • Document processes
  • Operate vehicle in a safely manner and use field automation systems
  • Follow all company’s filed procedures and protocols
  • Cooperate with technical team and share information across the organisation
  • Comprehend customer requirements and make appropriate recommendations/briefings
  • Build positive relationships with customers

Qualifications and Skills

The Elevator Apprentice should:

  • Understand lean manufacturing principles and process troubleshooting skills
  • Have strong knowledge of process capabilities, being able to compare the process specification to the process output and determine statistically if the process can meet the customer’s specification.
  • Be open to learning new techniques and protocols
  • Proven field service experience
  • Ability to troubleshoot, test, repair and service technical equipment
  • English literacy
  • Familiarity with mobile tools and applications
  • Technical degree or certification

 

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $11.00 to $14.00 /hour

item.title: Accounts Payable/HR
item.description:
Great company to work for with one of the largest and leading manufacturing companies!

 

Accounts Payable Job Duties:

  • Reconciles processed work by verifying entries and comparing system reports to balances.
  • Charges expenses to accounts and cost centers by analyzing invoice/expense reports; recording entries.
  • Pays vendors by monitoring discount opportunities; verifying federal id numbers; scheduling and preparing checks; resolving purchase order, contract, invoice, or payment discrepancies and documentation; insuring credit is received for outstanding memos; issuing stop-payments or purchase order amendments.
  • Pays employees by receiving and verifying expense reports and requests for advances; preparing checks.
  • Maintains accounting ledgers by verifying and posting account transactions.
  • Verifies vendor accounts by reconciling monthly statements and related transactions.
  • Maintains historical records by microfilming and filing documents.
  • Disburses petty cash by recording entry; verifying documentation.
  • Reports sales taxes by calculating requirements on paid invoices.
  • Protects organization's value by keeping information confidential.
  • Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities.
  • Accomplishes accounting and organization mission by completing related results as needed.

Accounts Payable Clerk Skills and Qualifications:

Tracking Budget Expenses, Attention to Detail, Thoroughness, Organization, Analyzing Information , Accounting, Vendor Relationships, PC Proficiency, Data Entry Skills, General Math Skills

 

Human Resources Job Duties:

  • Ensures planning, monitoring, and appraisal of employee work results by training managers to coach and discipline employees; scheduling management conferences with employees; hearing and resolving employee grievances; counseling employees and supervisors.
  • Maintains employee benefits programs and informs employees of benefits by studying and assessing benefit needs and trends; recommending benefit programs to management; directing the processing of benefit claims; obtaining and evaluating benefit contract bids; awarding benefit contracts; designing and conducting educational programs on benefit programs.
  • Ensures legal compliance by monitoring and implementing applicable human resource federal and state requirements; conducting investigations; maintaining records; representing the organization at hearings.
  • Maintains management guidelines by preparing, updating, and recommending human resource policies and procedures.

Human Resources Manager Skills and Qualifications:

Hiring, Human Resources Management, Benefits Administration, Performance Management, Communication Processes, Compensation and Wage Structure, Supports Diversity, Classifying Employees, Employment Law, Laws Against Sexual Harassment, Organization

item.title: CDL Class A Driver
item.description:
Are you looking for a local CDL Class A driving job?

Are you looking for a dayshift job?

@Work Group is seeking a highly motivated Class A delivery driver to join a fast growing beverage business.

This position requires lifting and loading cases ranging from 20-45 pounds repeatedly during work hours; and pushing/pulling using from 40 - 80 pounds of force, occasionally. It also requires reaching, squatting and bending while delivering and merchandising products in the store.
Unloads pallets of product from the delivery vehicle with an electronic pallet jack.

PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITIES:

  • Deliver product to clients
  • Service all scheduled customers by the end of shift
  • Establish positive working relationships with primary contact at each account

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

  • 21 years or older
  • Pass the DOT drug test and DOT Physical
  • Pass the background check
  • Valid CDL - class A license

HELPFUL EXPERIENCE:

  • Operating trucks requiring a CDL license (for example, performing basic functions like driving forwards, driving backwards, or maneuvering in tight spaces)
  • Adhering to all DOT regulations (for example, reading and comprehending documentation or maintaining current documentation such as medical cards)
  • Using equipment to aid in hauling loads (for example, operating pallet jacks, using dock plates, or using load bars and straps)
  • Operating equipment (pallet jacks, lift gates on trailers, hand trucks, breakdowns, etc.)

For additional information please visit our office at 1725 S Beckham Avenue in Tyler and ask for Maria or call our office at 903-508-4925. Apply online with resume.

item.title: Customer service rep
item.description:
We’re searching for a Customer Service Representative for our client in Medley, Florida. The right individual will be devoted to excellent customer service & looking for long-term employment.

 

About the job:

This is an entry-level customer service/general office position which requires an honest, organized, self-motivated individual with a strong work ethic, computer skills, and the ability to multitask.

 

Job responsibilities include, but not limited to:

Customer related transactions (order processing, scheduling & tracking shipments, etc.)

Data/order entry

General office support

Answering phone calls & responding to general inquiries

 

After probation period:

Annual raise & bonus (based on performance)

Health & long-term disability insurance

Retirement plan (SIMPLE IRA) with company match

Paid vacation plus personal/sick days

 

Requirements/Skills:

High school (or equivalent) graduate

Comfortable on computer & experience with Microsoft programs, especially Word & Excel

Strong communication skills - MUST be able to speak, read & write fluently/properly in English

Preferably bilingual (Spanish), but not required

Can handle a high volume of phone calls in a clear, polite & professional manner

Must be dependable & punctual

Experience with domestic & international exporting/shipping is a plus

Familiar with the metric system; basic algebra is a plus

 

Salary:

$12 to $14 Depending on experience

Hours: 8:30am to 5:00pm.

item.title: Product Manager
item.description:
Atwork is looking to hire Production Manager for our client, a large national bottling company in Sacramento. 

The Production Manager organizes and directs all related departmental activities through direct reports supervising each shift. The Production Manager will be responsible for management to include continuous improvement activities, planning, capital expenditures and reporting as required. The Production Manager will be a site champion for Lean Six Sigma processes. This position is accountable for delivering the established site goals for quality, productivity, budgetary and environmental, health and safety compliance.

Position Responsibilities

• Ensures the timely execution of the production schedule through management practices.

• Champion continuous improvement activities in production to include Lean Six Sigma Activities.

• Performs administrative reporting for operation in SAP environment.

• Develop production team using best practice methods.

• Manage budgetary responsibilities for the department.

• Manage Safety, Maintenance, Quality and Sanitation programs for manufacturing lines.

 

 

Qualifications

• Six Sigma White Belt Certification

• 5 years of manufacturing/production scheduling experience

• 5 years supervisory experience

• 2 years’ experience in SAP

• 2 years’ experience in industrial maintenance

• 2 years’ of bottling experience

item.title: Housekeeper
item.description:
Job Title: Housekeeper

Location: Novi, MI

Compensation: 10.00 hourly

Type: Full Time/Permanent

Our client in Northville (8 Mile and Haggerty) is looking for experienced house-keepers to clean assigned hotel rooms in accordance with hotel policies and procedures.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

  • Receives list of assigned rooms from supervisor at start of shift and proceeds to floor area. Wears hotel-provided uniform.
  • Checks for rooms requesting early cleaning and handles these first.
  • Announces presence by knocking on guest room doors; returns at a later time to clean occupied rooms.
  • Removes old sheets, pillow cases, blankets, and bedspread from bed; puts old sheets and pillow cases in laundry cart. Removes trash, newspapers, and cigarette ends to housekeeping cart.
  • Takes new sheets from housekeeping cart, positions sheet(s) on bed, and tucks in place. Replaces blankets and bedspread.
  • Cleans tub, toilet, and sinks.
  • Replenishes toiletries, stationery, and envelopes per hotel procedures.
  • Vacuums room, sprays fresh scent, and conducts a final walk-around to assure that room meets hotel housekeeping standards. Turns off air conditioning or lowers heat for unoccupied rooms.
  • Following a supervisory inspection of the room, returns to correct any deficiencies observed.
  • Advises supervisor of room availability for new guests via two-way radio.
  • Restocks housekeeping cart at end of shift with supplies sufficient for next shift.

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • May report suspicious activity to security.
  • May work in laundry room area loading washers and dryers and folding sheets.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Neat appearance to represent hotel positively with guests.
  • Requires ability to read, write, speak, understand, and communicate in English.
  • Job requires frequent bending.
  • Willingness to work a rotation seven-day work cycle and Holidays.
  • MUST be experienced.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $10.00 /hour

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $10.00 /hour

item.title: Maintenance Supervisor
item.description:
DIRECT HIRE OPPORTUNITY!! Our manufacturing client seeking a Maintenance Supervisor to manage the activities of the maintenance personnel and operational readiness of equipment and fixtures for the plant.

  • Great company benefits including Health care and 401k
  • Serve as a member of the company’s safety effort. Conduct departmental safety meetings; enforce the company’s safety regulations and work closely with the safety representatives/personnel to provide on-going safety improvements.
  • Plan the daily scheduling of maintenance personnel and their activities. Develop procedures for improving equipment maintenance and performance to increase “up-time”.
  • Work with outside vendors and equipment manufacturers; order and maintain spare parts inventory.
  • Perform various administrative tasks to include: Tracking labor hours, utilizing KRONOS timekeeping system, performance evaluations, recording statistics for planning purposes, and filling out purchase orders.
  • Hire, train, discipline and coach maintenance personnel on both Preventive and Corrective maintenance requirements. Responsible for the general supervision of the maintenance department.
  • Responsible for the maintenance of complicated CNC automated equipment valued in excess of several hundred thousand dollars each.
  • Provide minor repairs and improvements for internal fabrication plant facilities. Works with the Fabrication Manager on larger repairs and projects as needed.
  • Responsible for the overall supervision of maintenance personnel assigned to multiple shifts.
  • Plan for the installation of large capital projects.

Experience:

  • Three years supervisory experience.

Skills/Abilities:

  • Knowledge and firm understanding of mechanical, electrical and pneumatic systems.
  • Manufacturing maintenance with strong interpersonal and leadership skills. 
  • Require organization, prioritization, discretion and good judgment in decision making and interpretation of information. 
  • Ability to work independently, take initiative and accept responsibility.
  • Ability to utilize time management to set and adjust priorities to maximize plant equipment effectiveness and think strategically to balance immediate needs with long-term objectives.
  • Must be able to manage multiple projects with critical deadlines. Ability to identify and utilize a variety of resources to complete assignments.
  • Ability to define problems, collect data and establish facts and draw valid conclusions.

item.title: Bank Teller
item.description:
Position Summary:

The Teller role is a critical position for selected branch teams in helping the branches achieve its sales, service and operational goals while maintaining exceptional customer service.

 

The Teller will perform efficient and accurate banking transactions while:

  • Communicating clearly with clients
  • Making clients feel appreciated
  • Making it easy to do business with the bank

Position Responsibilities:

    • Engage client by welcoming them with a warm friendly smile, pleasant demeanor, using the client name, whenever possible.
    • Executes financial transactions in accordance with bank policies and procedures while maintaining an acceptable record in daily drawer balancing
    • Listens carefully to the client and willingly assists with any questions or problems the client has
    • Makes sure all needs are met before concluding the transaction, making the client feel his/her time is being valued without being rushed
    • Shows initiative, empathy and proactively prevents and handles problems with clients while assisting other tellers as well
    • Effectively executes all service and referral routines to deepen client relationships
    • Adheres to operational controls, including legal, corporate, and regulatory procedures to ensure the safety and security of customer and bank assets
    • Exhibits strong sales and service skills, presenting products and services while proactively educating clients on utilizing available access channels (ex: ATM, Online and Telephone Banking)
    • Continuously learns new and existing products through sales aids
    • Knowledgeable about the client’s accounts and business with the bank and uses sound judgment with customers and transactions
    • Proven track record of client-centric service
    • Duties may include managing the supply of cash for branch needs based on business demand, in addition to managing incoming/outgoing cash shipments/maintains vault cash, including buying and selling of cash with branch Tellers and ATMs, as needed
item.job:requirements:
Qualifications

      • Retail/sales experience preferred
      • Ability to assist customers and provide effective on-the-job coaching to other staff members
      • Sales, cashier or other money-handling experience desired
      • Proven cross-sell experience
      • New Account experience
      • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
      • Analytical and problem solving B77
      • Basic computer skills
      • 12 months cumulative work experience in a role of similar scope and responsibility preferred
      • High school diploma, GED or equivalent relevant experience

item.title: Financial Reporting Analyst
item.description: Job Summary:   This position will analyze financial status by collecting, monitoring, studying data, writing journal entries as necessary and recommending actions to management.  To excel in this role you need a proven ability to use, modify and create various reports, introduce to others for their use and modify them with an emphasis on continuous improvement. Reporting includes Daily Margin analysis and reporting, Weekly Cash Flow Analysis, Monthly Financial reporting to both internal and external users (bank, auditor) and Annual Budgeting analysis and reporting (including providing uploads to the ERP system).   In addition, this position handles governmental contact for the organization:  business tax registration and payments for the US, tracking and paying income taxes per auditor instructions, responding to confidential surveys for representations and certifications from government customers.

item.title: Hydraulic Technician/Fabricator
item.description:
AtWork Personnel Irondale is looking for an experience Hydraulic Technician/Fabricator for a local Hydraulic Repair Service.

 

SUMMARY:

Build, troubleshoot, and repair hydraulic equipment. Fabricate sub-assemblies and small shop jobs.

 

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned. 

Troubleshoot, repair, and test hydraulic and lubrication pumps and related components. 

Document components required for repairs and estimate required labor hours.

Assemble small jobs using hand tools and small power tools.

Work with senior technicians on hydraulic power unit systems.

Travel to customer locations to troubleshoot existing hydraulic systems and machinery. 

Travel to customer locations to install hydraulic equipment including some overnight travel.

Overtime work will be required occasionally.

www.atwork.com/irondale

-CREATE LOGIN AND PASSWORD

-SELECT IRONDALE, AL FOR LOCATION

item.job:requirements:
COMPETENCIES

To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:

ANALYSIS- Demonstrates attention to detail, Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner, communicates changes and progress; completes projects on time and budget. 

TECHNICAL SKILLS- Pursues training and development opportunities; strives to continuously build knowledge and skills.

ORAL COMMUNICATION- Listens and gets clarification; responds well to questions and feedback.

QUALITY MANAGEMENT- Looks for ways to improve and promote quality; demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; uses time efficiently.

ETHICS- Treats people with respect; keeps commitments; works with integrity and ethically.

SAFETY AND SECURITY- Observes safety and security procedures; uses equipment and materials properly.

ADAPTABILITY- Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events. 

ATTENDANCE/PUNCTUALITY- Is consistently at work and on time.

INITIATIVE- Undertakes self-development activities; asks for and offers help when needed. 

 

MATHEMATICAL SKILLS

Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs. 

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.  Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. 

CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS 

Current driver's license

OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Ability to use hand tools effectively and quickly.

Fabrication and welding skills preferred. 

Use shop equipment such as saws, mills, pipe threader, and lathe.

Ability to read and understand hydraulic schematics.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS 

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to stand; use hands to complete work and reach with hands and arms. The employee is frequently required to walk and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee is occasionally required to climb or balance. The employee must regularly lift and /or move up to 10 pounds, frequently lift and /or move up to 25 pounds and occasionally lift and /or move up to 50 pounds.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 

While performing the duties of the Job, the employee is regularly exposed to wet and / or humid conditions and moving mechanical parts. The employee is occasionally exposed to high, precarious places; fumes or airborne particles; toxic or caustic chemicals; outside weather conditions and risk of electrical shock. The noise level in the work environment is usually loud.

item.description:
Do you like the adrenaline rush of roller coasters, bungee jumping, rock climbing, mountain climbing, rappelling, or zip lines? Maybe you would like to experience that same rush every day at work?

While everyone you know is all cozy & cool inside their air-conditioned homes, the hard-working line clearance crews are doing everything it takes to create and keep those power lines running smoothly. Nationwide. When natural disaster strikes, line clearance steps up to clear the path to recovery.

In Sunshine, Rain, and Snow.

Be a part of this team of silent heroes, and get all cozy & snug inside your new, permanent career.

 

Full Time

$11.50-$12.00 per hour

 

Responsibilities:

  • Cut back trees and brush
  • Solid member of your line clearance team
  • Pull/haul/cut/drag/ feed brush into a wood chipper

  • Use a chainsaw/leaf blower/etc.

item.title: Tool Maker - Die Maintenance
item.description:
A Triad manufacturer is looking for a Tool and Die Maker to perform a variety of operations to construct, repair, troubleshoot and improve progressive dies or transfer tooling.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Vocational training, Toolmaker Tool&Die Maker or Die Maintenance and 4+ year’s relevant experience or 5+ years relevant experience.
  • Required to do manual machining on mills, grinders and lathes.
  • Strong tooling maintenance and repair background a must.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Analytical troubleshooting skills essential.
  • Must have knowledge and experience of progressive, transfer or draw tooling.
  • Good communication skills, especially with others.
  • Must be a team player.
  • CAD Design knowledge, preferably SolidWorks.
  • Able to work independently and with limited supervision.
  • State approved Journeymen Tool and Die Maker is a plus.

Job Duties

  • Modify or repair existing tooling and progressive dies.
  • Examine standard or previously used dies and tooling components and recommend design modifications regarding construction and functionality.
  • May have to interface with Tool Engineering and Management on die and process improvements.
  • Applying Root Cause Analysis to tooling breakages and premature failure.
  • Analyzes the Problems and implement permanent corrective actions.
  • Provide direction and leadership to progressive die design, die manufacturing, die repair and fixture manufacturing.
  • May coordinate team’s continuous improvement activities.
  • May lead Tooling Projects and/or work as Stamping Set up Personal.
  • Requisition necessary material, components and services for progressive die manufacturing.
  • Studies specifications such as blueprints, sketches, models or descriptions, and visualizes product to determine materials required and machines needed to fabricate tooling.
  • Recommend revisions in design and/or substitutions in material based on “machine-ability” or fabrication problems encountered.
  • Verifies conformance of machined and stamped parts to specifications through the use of calipers, micrometers, gauge blocks, height gauges, etc.
  • Operates from detailed blueprints yet able to conceptualize and fabricate specialty tooling and fixtures.
  • Knowledge of metal characteristics and properties including heat-treating.
  • Strong orientation towards quality, safety and continuous improvement.
  • Ability to expand job responsibilities, suggests improvements, and collaborates with others to generate ideas and improve processes.
  • May provide guidance to less experienced employees or apprentice.
  • Maintains work area in a neat and orderly condition.
  • Performs other related duties and assignments as required.
  • The positions involves periodically bending, reaching, kneeling, climbing ladders, moving and lifting heavy objects.
  • Stand, walk or sit for the full length of shift per day.
  • Overtime may be required at times.

item.title: Customer Service Specialist
item.description:
The role of C.S.Sr.  will assist in being responsible for handling long stablished Wholesale/Distributors accounts with its purchasing managers, owners, and with our inter office departments, with the objective that these products be delivered on time, to the proper destination, in the quantity ordered, and with the agreed upon quality standards to be consistent with the expectations of the company and our customers.  The operations team is to meet customer expectations while managing costs. 


ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

 

  • Reports to the Customer Service Manager
  • Ensuring superior customer service is delivered at all times to all customers both external and internal.
  • Must have 2-3 years of customer service experience. Position will start as a temporary (40 hrs/week) role under a temporarily assignment and will move to a Permanent position after the probation period of approximately 4-5 months after completion.
  • Person must be able to keep up with the daily KPIs set forth for the department (orders, returns credits, coop claims, etc.).
  • This role will expose key individual to most business principles (Supply Chain, Customer Relations Management (CRM), Accounting, International Business and Inside Sales).
  • Must be able to work on a computer for 8 hours a day while answering 100’s of emails, phones calls
  • MUST HAVE intermediate to expert understanding of Microsoft systems (Excel, Outlook, Access, Word, etc.).
  • Will be trained to create / review various reports in order to improve the management of our customers both internal and external.
  • Will be cross-trained on various facets of the Admin Team (Accounting, Marketing, invoices, mail machine operations, reception coverage, office supplies ordering, conference calls/ meeting arrangements, etc…)
  • This position requires the ability to execute data entry of sales orders, coop claims, returns credits from customers both internal and external. This position also requires the customer service rep to execute a great deal of follow up with the customers and sales reps.
  • Position will also require the individual to work on special projects with other departments, such as Marketing, Accounting and Sales.
  • Experience operating in an EDI environment is a plus, as well as experience having worked on e-commerce projects.
  • Ensure that all transactions that affect the branch inventory and accounts receivable are processed accurately
  • Will be required to be proficient in managing accounts, customers, processes and systems.
  • Work with other departments on sales, marketing and supply chain initiatives
  • Authorize and ensure validity of customer Returns, Coop Claims, Credits, Check requests and Purchase Orders
  • Experience with SAGE, ALTEC and/or other customer planning systems a plus.
  • Proactively accepts additional duties and/or responsibilities as directed by management.
  • Must be able to speak and write Spanish and English, Portuguese a Plus
  • Must be detailed oriented and willing to show work performance
item.job:requirements:
EDUCATION, SKILLS AND OR EXPERIENCE NEEDED:

 

  • College Degree is a plus. High School diploma is required
  • Must be able to multi-task and have strong problem-solving and analytical skills coupled with the ability to think on your feet.
  • Must have a demonstrated record of team development and leadership.
  • Must have a keen eye for detail, a commitment to accuracy and possess exceptional organizational skills.
  • Must have a strong work ethic.
  • A positive attitude, a friendly personality and a passion for working with people. Outstanding communication skills. Individual must be diplomatic, patient, and a good listener.
  • The ability to work in high-pressure situations in a deadline-driven environment.
  • Strong computer skills, including the ability to master new systems and to enter data quickly and accurately.
  • Microsoft Outlook, Excel and Word experience is required.
  • Must be able to speak and write Spanish and English, Portuguese a Plus

 

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

 

  • This position requires individual to sit for intermittent periods of time. May require light lifting, bending, stooping or reaching.
  • Overtime working is required.

item.title: Senior Credit and Collections Specialist
item.description:
Looking to work for a company voted as one of the best companies to work in San Diego?  Would like a job for a rapidly growing and expanding sports medicine company? Do you have expert business to business experience in collections?

Apply now and call Sharon 442-287-0300

Senior Credit Specialist

Job Summary

The Senior Credit Specialist position is responsible for safeguarding accounts receivable by reviewing daily orders, the collection of past due balances and reconciliation of disputed amounts. S/he will provide excellent customer service to internal and external customers by consistent, courteous and timely communication regarding account status. BUSINESS TO BUSINESS EXPERIENCE REQUIRED.

Essential Job Functions

  • Manages credit hold accounts by reviewing held orders and analyzing customer agings, credit limits, customer credit history and/or third party credit reports to safeguard our accounts
  • Reconciles account balances to resolve disputes and maintains integrity of accounts receivable.
  • Sets up appropriate credit limits for established accounts based on customer's credit worthiness and projected annual
  • Exhibits professional behavior with both internal and external business associates that is consistent with the company's policies and practices and reflects positively on the
  • Works along with Sales Reps, Collections and International Accounts in taking responsibility for larger accounts that require high-level problem solving skills that need to be managed for an increased volume of risk. 
  • Generates timely reports such as DSO, and Month End Financial package information 
  • Assists management with development of the team and participates in the creation and maintenance of departmental procedures
item.job:requirements:
Qualifications

  • Associates Degree or its equivalent in experience in Accounting, Finance or Business
  • Proven ability to be pro-active, problem-solve and multi-task while managing a varied workload with constantly changing
  • 5+ years of Accounts Receivable to include Credit and Collections is
  • Must have knowledge of standard accounts receivable reports, such as DSO and Account Receivable agings.
  • Credit programs coursework through NACM or local chapter is
  • Must have strong computerized accounting skills, intermediate spreadsheet and business writing skills are required.

Competencies

Demonstrates ownership and accountability; demonstrates the ability to plan, execute, control and deliver; to be adaptable; displays ability and expresses interest in training, coaching and developing others; demonstrates expertise in analytical and negotiation skills; to communicate effectively both written and verbal; to lead and influence others effectively.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $21.00 to $26.00 /hour

Apply now and call Sharon 442-287-0300

item.job:additionalinfo:
Permanent schedule is 10 am to 7 pm; during training the schedule will vary and will begin at 9:30 am to be adjusted accordingly.

The permanent schedule includes rotating weekend and holiday schedule. 

Candidate must be flexible; there may be a need to come in earlier and/or stay later, depending on the workload (40 hrs/week minimum)

item.title: Coating Operator
item.description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

    • Perform manufacturing tasks as assigned in the manufacturing department with proficiency in all aspects of tablet coating.

    • Operate and clean manufacturing coating room and equipment.

    • Operate and clean all coating and solution preparation equipment used in the film coating operation.

    • Set up coating equipment and calibrate spray guns.

    • Transport core tablets from staging area to coating room. Verify all core tablet containers for accuracy and quantities received.

    • Operate tablet coating machines as per product batch record following Standard Operating Procedures.

    • Calculate tablet weight gain and document all in process quality checks.

    • Load the tablet coater with tablet cores.

    • Set up the coaters Compu-Coat system according to the validated coating parameters. 

    • Monitor validated coating parameters make adjustment as needed.

    • Un-load coated tablets into container for weight out. 

    • Calculate and document USP water and colorant weight in the batch record.

    • Transport solution to coating room. 

    • Document all process readings in the manufacturing batch record. 

    • Perform changeover and set-up of designated manufacturing equipment.

    • Practice Good Manufacturing procedure as trained in cGMP training.

    • Required to wear appropriate safety equipment and adhere to safety procedures and Federal and State regulations.

    • Monitor coating machine operation periodically and report any abnormal conditions to the immediate Supervisor.

    • Assist manufacturing supervisor in the collection of information to conduct investigations.

    • Follow procedures described in SOP’s and report deviations to the immediate supervisor.

    • Facilitate and cooperate with any Continuous Improvement Program.

    • Perform other duties as assigned by supervisor.

JOB REQUIREMENTS

    • High School diploma or equivalent. 

    • 5-7 years experience as solid dose Manufacturing Operator. 

    • Demonstrated proficiency in the English Language, both written and oral.

    • Proficiency in basic math.

    • Ability to lift routinely 30-60 lbs.

    • Exposure to vitamins, mineral, herbal, and OTC products disagreeable odors, high-noise levels, continuous standing.  No allergies.

  • Adhere to pre-established manufacturing schedule.

 

This is a third shift position from 10 pm to 6:30 am

item.title: Accounting Manager
item.description:
Successful candidate manages and oversees daily activities of Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, Payroll, Fixed Asset, and General Ledger functions, ensuring accurate and timely processing of all financial transactions. Mentors and leads staff assigned to these functions. ACTIVE CPA is REQUIRED. 

  • Oversees the activities of the Accounts Receivable function to ensure the accurate and timely management of all Accounts Receivable components including billings, collections, revenue recognition and reporting.
  • Oversees the activities of the Accounts Payable function to ensure the accurate and timely processing of accounts payable invoices, accurate recording of transactions, 1099 issuance and sales/use tax compliance.
  • Oversees the activities of the Payroll function to ensure the accurate and timely processing of payroll checks and payroll tax filings in multiple states.
  • Ensures that Constrution projects and Fixed Assets are properly recorded and depreciated in accordance with the Company's policies and GAAP.
  • Oversees the activities of the General Ledger Function to ensure the accurate and timely closing of the General Ledger.
  • Assures all transactions are recorded in adherence to Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, including researching the impact of new accounting pronoucements and its affect on existing policies.
  • Manage issuance of corporate credit cards and ensure transactions are recorded appropriately.
  • Establishes and maintains processes and controls to achieve maximum efficiencies and adherence of accounting policies and procedures which verify the integrity of all systems, processes and data, and enhance the Company's value.
  • Ensures accurate and timely financial reporting to internal management and parent company.
  • Oversees all required statutory filings with all governmental agencies.
  • Provides guidance to Controller and Company senior management with respect to accounting policies and technical accounting interpretations.
  • Performs weekly cash management and forecast.
  • Performs monthly Balance Sheet and Profit and Loss account analysis by location.
  • Works closely with other department managers on interdepartmental process flows to support corporate goals.
  • Trains and mentors department staff.
  • Assists in the completion of special projects.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.
item.job:requirements:
• Bachelor Degree in Accounting
  • Active CPA required
  • 8 + years of Accounting/Finance experience
  • 3+ years in a leadership role

item.title: Team Leader
item.description:
Job Description

Position: Team Leader

Industry: Automotive

Job Type: Full Time/Permanent

Shift: 5a-2p

Location: Sterling Heights MI

Job Summary

Supervises the activities of production personnel engaged in all facets of the manufacturing function. A level I supervisor is considered a working supervisor with little authority for personnel actions. May require a bachelor's degree in area of specialty. Familiar with a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures. Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected. Typically reports to a manager or head of a unit/department.

Job Description

Duties & Responsibilities Information:

  • Ensures workstations meet all safety, 1+5S and TPM requirements by being actively involoved with the assessment of all workstations per Quality and 1+5S guidelines
  • Reviews all Method Sheets that apply to work performed within the department and facilitates training of all employees per proper Method Sheets and Training Procedures with HR
  • Facilitates proper scanning of work orders within the Oracle Production System to ensure accurate production reporting and inventory; ensures all rework tickets are filled out and turned in to the proper department
  • Influences team members by displaying a positive proactive work ethic that sets the standards for maintaining a safe, productive work environment while setting and maintaining high quality standards and striving for continuous improvement
  • Functions as a working production team member as needed
  • Maintains First5 Boards and conducts First5 Meeting in Supervisors absence
  • Facilitates and helps maintain all lean enterprise initiatives, 1+5S, TPM, VSM requirements
  • Signs off on all completed department outbound production prior to movement to the next level of production
  • Performs other duties as assigned by Supervisor or Team Leader

Necessary Skills:

  • Demonstrated leadership ability

Notes : Must have five years of hands on industrial manufacturing, experience, preferably in rotating equipment applications

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $15.00 /hour

item.title: Dock Auditor
item.description:
Job Title: Dock Auditor

Location: Sterling Heights MI

Type: Full Time/Permanent

Shift: 2nd  (2pm-10pm)

 

Job Summary

Dock Auditor. ... The Warehouse Auditor is responsible for auditing orders on the dock to ensure the correct quantity and products are being shipped to the customer. Auditors assist in maintaining an acceptable error rate on orders shipped according to guidelines.

 

Job Description

 

Dock Auditor 

  • Audit final packaged product at prescribed frequency to verify weight, # of pieces,

ensure correct documentation is present, and that container product is in good

condition.

  • Audit incoming product from subcontractors to verify applicable documentation is

present.

  • Audit incoming product from subcontractors to verify quality of work preferred, as

appropriate.

  • Maintain documentation showing the checks completed for each day.
  • Perform all duties as requested by supervisor.

 

All shifts - including 2nd and 3rd, with sporadic 1st shift availability.

The Data Entry Clerk accurately enters data into a computer. This data includes quantities, lot codes, item numbers, sales order numbers, dates and freight rates. In addition, the data entry clerk will print documents such as bills of lading and packing lists for delivery personnel. The data entry clerk provides support to the warehouse operation.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Promotes safety and conducts him/herself in accordance with all safety guidelines at all times.
  • Utilize Syspro ( ERP System) to update sales orders for shipment.
  • Reads source documents such as pick lists to verify order accuracy in Syspro.
  • Resolves discrepancies on picked orders.
  • Obtain rate quotes for LTL carriers.
  • Verify accuracy of shipping documents.
  • Files completed documents and copies in appropriate locations.
  • Identify and correct data entry errors and report them to supervisors when necessary.
  • Prints bill of lading and shipping documents for all shipments.
  • Utilize standard office equipment.
  • Punctual and on time.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

  • Must be able to physically perform the functions of climbing, balancing, stooping, kneeling, crouching, reaching, standing, walking, pushing, pulling, lifting, grasping, feeling, talking, hearing, and repetitive motions. Those typically found in a logistics and warehouse setting.
  • Must possess visual acuity to document company records.
  • Must be able to lift 40 pounds.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Must demonstrate attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy.
  • Must work well in a team environment.
  • Must be able to work overtime as required.
  • Must have good job performance and attendance records.

item.title: 3rd Shift Industrial Food Maintenance Mechanic
item.description:
Job Summary

3rd Shift Industrial Maintenance Technician job opportunity with fantastic, food manufacturing plant. Great benefits and incentives. Must have experience working in a Manufacturing Plant.

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/EXPERIENCE :

GENERAL KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS

  • Must be able to demonstrate mechanical ability and skills and carry out daily maintenance activities, plant rounds, preventative maintenance, plant calls and continual improvement assignments.
  • Must have general maintenance troubleshooting skills and equipment component knowledge to properly diagnose equipment failures.
  • Must understand proper lubrication practices of bearings, chains, and gearboxes.
  • Must be capable of using all shop and hand tools and equipment in a safe and proper manner
  • Must be able to perform all assigned equipment service in a professional manner and follow instructions.
  • Must be able to follow, understand and utilize work logs, breakdown reports, work orders and preventive maintenance logs.

ELECTRICAL SKILLS

  • Must meet or exceed the following electrical requirements
  • Demonstrate the ability to use a voltmeter properly to identify voltage, amperage and resistance of an electrical circuit.
  • Demonstrate the ability to read and utilize electrical schematics to diagnose electrical problems.
  • Demonstrate ability to properly electrically disconnect and reconnect DC, AC, motion control and Wye-Delta Motors.

MECHANICAL SKILLS

  • Able to distinguish and identify chain, sprockets, gearbox types and belts.
  • Able to identify shaft sizes and material of construction.
  • Able to identify and distinguish bolts and nuts sizes, applications and material of construction.
  • Able to identify basic equipment parts and components for job assignments.
  • Capable of tracking product conveyor belts
  • Perform effective preventive maintenance on equipment with minimal supervision.

WELDING

  • Demonstrate basic ability to weld metal, stick, or Heliarc.
  • Demonstrate the ability to perform basic copper soldering
  • Demonstrate the proper use of oxy/acetylene torch in cutting and brazing.

REFRIGERATION

  • Demonstrate basic refrigeration comprehension and understanding of refrigeration fundamentals, components and their functions.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS:

  • Maintains good attendance and punctuality. Follows established work schedule.
  • Must have excellent communication skills both oral and written.
  • Maintain a positive and respectful attitude; cooperate with co-workers, management, internal and external customers, as applicable. Reports any incidents of harassment to his Supervisor or Human Resources Manager.
  • Must be able to take direction and follow instructions.
  • Must work safely at all times and report any unsafe conditions or injuries to his Supervisor or Safety Manager immediately.

Must be willing to comply with other duties, assigned by direct supervisors.

MINIMUM REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS, EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE :

  • 5 years’ experience working with industrial equipment
  • High School Graduate or GED
  • Must be able to provide personnel tools to perform all assigned maintenance tasks
  • Must be willing to work flexible hours.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

  • Must be able to regularly lift and or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and or move 50 pounds.
  • Must be able to work on ladders, scissor lifts, scaffolding and other high precarious places safely and effectively.
  • Must be able to work around electrical, mechanical, hydraulic, pneumatic and thermodynamic equipment safely.

item.title: Warehouse Administrative Assistant
item.description:
Job Summary   

Self motivated warehouse administrative assistant. The ideal candidate has a positive attitude, organized and has great attention to detail.  This individual must be able to keep up in a fast paced environment, and adjust to changing  priorities in a warehouse environment. 

  •  Assist the Operations department with paperwork and clerical duties 
  • Coordinate and maintain organization with work orders and purchase orders; enter into  database, file, follow up on orders until they are received, close work orders and follow  up with other departments until the task is complete  Update and maintain installation files with accurate job information 
  • Assist in locating product and/or vendors for new or specific products 
  • Receive and process repair/maintenance calls 
  • Initiate repair orders and follow up to completion 
  • Assist with arranging for rental equipment 
  • Review job completion reports for discrepancies and/or necessary repairs 
  • Review projects in advance of installation 
  • Maintain documentation organization with all job orders 
  • Perform any other duties assigned by supervisor   
  • Full time Seasonal Employment   June to Jan 2019: must be able to work flexible  schedule and weekends 

Qualifications: 

  • Intermediate Microsoft Office, Word, Excel, and Outlook, required 
  • Must have 2 or more years of experience in warehouse operations 
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written 
  • Ability to prioritize tasks and ensure their completion. 
  • Bilingual/Spanish, required!

item.title: Material Handler
item.description:
Job Description

  

Material Handler 2nd shift 5pm-2am

 

Prerequisites

·         High School Diploma or recognized equivalent is preferred

·         Candidate must be able to understand and practise Kanban, and FIFO methods

·         Criminal Background Check

·         Post Offer Pre-Employment Physical

·         Drug Screen

·         Valid Fork Lift License Required

 

Reports To

Department

·         Area Leader

·         Distribution

 

FLSA Status

Budget Responsibility

·         Non-Exempt

·         NONE

 

General Responsibility

·         Safely material handle product to proper locations

·         Check against orders for quality, order accuracy and labeling

·         Ensure that trucks are properly loaded / unloaded to avoid damage to goods / trailer

·         Assist in cycle counts as required

·         Assist with returnable tote sorting as required

·         Ensures that safety procedures are followed and products are safely handled

·         Participate in daily Preventative Maintenance for assigned forklift

·         Demonstrate strong communication skills both written and verbal

·         Participate in 5S procedures for respective work areas

·         Adherence of all Safety & Health rules and regulations                                                                     

·         Must possess the computer skills required to enter or retrieve information and create reports                                                     

·         Participate in re-training requirements required as per applicable State/Federal Safety Standards   

·         Perform other shipping, maintenance, and general plant duties as required

 

Direct Responsibilities

·         Safe operation of a forklift to the accepted guidelines as per State/Federal Standards

·         Daily Preventative Maintenance procedures for forklift(s) adhered to

 

Physical Responsibilities

·         May be required to repeatedly lift, push or pull up to 50 lbs unassisted

·         May be required to lift between 50-75 lbs assisted

·         Frequent use of hands, lifting, bending, stooping, twisting, standing and reaching may occur

·         There may be some stepping up, stepping down and carrying

 

Hazards/PPE
  • Office hazards minimal
  • Lift Truck Traffic

item.title: 2nd Shift Warehouse Forklift Driver
item.description:
AtWork Personnel Irondale is hiring motivated and self reliant Forklift Drivers for a local Beverage Distributor.

2nd Shift 

Warehouse Associates are responsible for loading, unloading, sorting, staging and transporting of products. Individuals in this position must work accommodatingly with other Associates and productively with little supervision. Following company safety policies and procedures is of great importance to this position. Upon completion of training and certification a Warehouse Associate may drive gasoline, liquefied gas, or electric powered industrial truck equipped with lifting devices such as forklift, clamp and slip sheet attachments, to push, pull, lift, stack, stage, or move products, equipment, or materials/pallets. Utilization of RF System, Racking and power equipment required.

*PLEASE CLICK THE LINK BELOW TO COMPLETE APPLICATION*

www.atwork.com/irondale

-SELECT IRONDALE, AL FOR LOCATION

-ATTACH RESUME
item.job:requirements:
Safely operates forklift and/or other machinery in order to complete tasks such as loading, unloading, sorting, staging and transporting products.

Check product on inbound / outbound to ensure that items and quantities are correct, and that there is no damage Unloads and stacks materials/pallets by raising and lowering lifting device.

Load, unload, move, stack and stage customer products and materials both by hand and lift.

Assist in cycle counts and physical inventories.

Recharges forklift batteries Perform daily maintenance inspections of equipment.

Complete time cards by accurately recording clock ID and function codes.

Maintains condition of Distribution Center and/or warehouse work area (I. e., free of trash, product in correct location, etc.).

Additional duties as assigned by Warehouse Management.

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE

• Have a HS Diploma or GED

• Must be eighteen years of age or older

• Are Forklift certified

• Have two years of Warehouse Experience

• Have at least one year experience working with an RF system

• Have AIB experience is a plus

• Must be willing to work overtime on short notice

• Must be able to pass a drug test

• Must be able to pass a background check

item.title: Maintenance Worker
item.description:
AtWork is seeking an experienced Maintenance Mechanic for our client in the Columbia, SC area. The Maintenance Mechanic will be be responsible for troubleshooting, repairing, and maintaining mechanical and electrical equipment including, but not limited to pneumatic and hydraulic systems, productions machines etc **Must have a mechanical background and able to drive a forklift** This position is 1st shift. Onsite training will be provided. 

Job functions:

  • Troubleshoot issues and make repairs and adjustments to mechanical, pneumatic, hydraulic and electrical (3 phase) equipment.
  • Wire complex control circuits.
  • Troubleshoot high voltage poly-phase and multi-speed motors.
  • Soldering on circuit board components.
  • Fabricate, repair, and install hangers and piping.
  • Weld various types of metal.
  • Calibrate scale systems.
  • Identify problems and complete repairs with minimal supervision.

Qualifications:

  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • 3 years technical training or 3 years related maintenance experience.
  • Lift, push, pull 50 pounds repeatedly.
  • Walking and standing for long periods of time.
  • Pass drug test and background check.

If you are interested in learning more about this excellent, Direct Hire opportunity, apply today for immediate consideration! Or call Michael Miller with AtWork Personnel at 803-814-0077.

item.title: CNC Machinist
item.description:
A Columbia, SC machine shop is currently seeking an experienced CNC Machinist. ** Must have at least 2 years of experience**

The company has been in business for over 35 years. Its services include repair, prototype, and production. Must be a self-starter and have the capability to read drawings and work without supervision.

Job Description:

  • Must have the capability to read drawings
  • Must have experience with Precision work
  • Correctly setup, run, diagnose, and edit programming on primarily Haas CNC Mills/ Lathes to meet daily production goals / small run prototype or repair quotes.
  • Tools and Machinery may include but not limited to: Haas CNC mills, Haas CNC lathes, Miyano BND twin spindle w/ live tooling, Haas tool room mill, prototrak, eztrak, bridgeport mills, engine lathes, manual mills, cylindrical grinders, surface grinders, and drill presses.
  • Lathe skills: Setup tools, tool offsets, work offsets, hand edit code, prove program and run.
  • Milling skills: Conventional, 2 axis CNC bridgeport, 3 axis verticals, and 4th axis knowledge. Must be able to setup tools, tools offsets, work offsets, hand edit code, prove programs and run.
  • Ability to read, understand, and diagnose CNC programs as well as follow proven work instructions.
  • Ability to use QA tools to verify dimensions and tolerances. Ex: Micrometers, calipers, bore gauges, trimics, height gauges, etc...
  • Ability to read and understand dimensional tolerances and geometric tolerances from blueprints.
  • Regularly performs milling, turning, drilling, tapping, de-burring, sawing and sanding tasks.
  • Assists in other work areas to perform welding, and some fabrications.
  • Ability to follow verbal and written instructions and follow up with clarifying questions.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

 

Pay:

$16-$22/hr.
item.job:requirements:
Job Requirements:

  • 3 years minimum on the job machining experience,
  • Must be fluent in setup, problem solving, G&M coding, and manual machining.
  • Must be willing to work evenings and weekends and overtime when needed.
  • Must be punctual and reliable
  • Strong technical and math skills.
  • Ability to read and understand most G&M — CNC codes
  • Ability to diagnose and correct dimensional errors in machine programming
  • Ability to read, understand, and diagnose CNC programs
  • Must be able to hold tolerances of .0005 - .001
  • Ability to read and understand dimensional tolerances and geometric tolerances from blueprints.
  • Ability to follow verbal and written instructions.
item.job:additionalinfo: Please email your resume in attention to Michael Miller: mmiller@atwork.com

item.title: Audiovisual Lead Technician
item.description:
We have a client that is looking to hire a full-time Audiovisual Lead Technician in the great city of San Antonio. This is an awesome opportunity to work for a market leader in the Audiovisual integration space. The company has been around for almost 20 years and is expanding all over the country. They are looking to find the right person to join their growing team in San Antonio. The position has a healthy compensation plan which is loaded with a robust benefits package, plenty of training and a plethora of other great perks. They look for people that will add to their culture and help make a difference for their clients. If you are in the market for something great then please get in touch with us so that we can have a conversation today.

 

Position: Audiovisual Lead Technician

 

Type: Full Time

 

Job Description Summary

The Audiovisual Lead Technician is responsible for various installation activities including, but not limited to: pre-wire on new and retrofit construction, installation of audio, video, security and automation systems, setup of computer networks and computer systems, universal and touch panel remote control programming, pick up of supplies and materials and other duties. The Lead Technician will be on a job site with and without direct supervision. The Lead Technician should have a demonstrated expertise with one or more systems: Phone, Computer, Audio/Video, Lighting Control, Security systems, or Home Automation Control systems.

 

Reporting Relationships

The Lead Technician reports to the Project Manager and may be supervised by a Foreman on a job site.

 

Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 

Education and Experience

Four-year college degree preferred. 2 to 4 years of experience in commercial Audio Video integration. Proficient in desktop computer software such as email, Microsoft Word, Excel, and Microsoft Visio.

 

Organizational and Time Management Skills

  • Self-directed individual
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment with and without supervision
  • Ability to follow a checklist, processes, and procedures to ensure job completion
  • Ability to complete testing, documentation, and customer training
  • Ability to troubleshoot systems problems in an effective and concise manner

 

Language Skills

Ability to communicate effectively with team leaders, managers and customers using written and verbal communications.

 

Reasoning Ability

Ability to interpret technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form, deal with several abstract and concrete variables and apply previous experience to solve problems.

 

Certificates, Licenses and Registrations

Valid Texas Driver's License

CTS Certification or CEDIA Level 1 preferred

 

Note

Out of state candidates are also encouraged to apply

item.title: Linen Service Specialist
item.description:
AtWork is currently hiring linen service specialist in the Altamonte Springs, FL area. This is a full time position with a great company. Apply today to join our award winning team!

 

Duties:

 

  • Restocks all linen carts on assigned route and within the assigned time frame, using only approved linen distribution equipment and accurately counting linen items and entering all data into linen management software as required. Assesses areas of assignment and makes suggestions for improvement.

    • Removes all foreign items and linen from carts that are in unacceptable condition, such as torn, unfolded, or soiled. Checks for and changes reject linen bags and ensures that an adequate supply of soiled linen bag boxes are always available in each linen cart. Straightens remaining linen in preparation for restocking.

    • Patrols work area: picks up strings and dropped linen placing it in proper containers. Delivers empty linen carts to designated areas.

    • Reports to supervisor any linen shortage and/or issues as requested 

    • Collects and handles soiled linen bags and delivers them to designated areas in a timely and professional manner when assigned.

    • Maneuvers large bins and/or linen carts in a safe and professional manner.

    • Adjusts to staff shortages and covers other assigned areas and/or campuses while maintaining high standards set by department team members

    • Performs other duties as assigned or directed to ensure the smooth operation of the department.

 

Requirements:

  • Previous experience in a laundry facility
  • Able to lift up to 50lbs and stand for long periods of time
  • Great customer service skills
  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • Able to pass a drug screen and background check

Schedule:

Altamonte Springs location (Full-time)

Monday-Thursday and Saturday

930PM-6AM

 

Orlando location (Part-time)

930PM-6AM

item.description:
A Winston-Salem machine shop is currently seeking an experienced CNC Machinist.

The company is family owned and operated. Its services include repair, prototype, and production.

Job Description:

  • Correctly setup, run, diagnose, and edit programming on primarily Haas CNC Mills/ Lathes to meet daily production goals / small run prototype or repair quotes.
  • Tools and Machinery may include but not limited to: Haas CNC mills, Haas CNC lathes, Miyano BND twin spindle w/ live tooling, Haas tool room mill, prototrak, eztrak, bridgeport mills, engine lathes, manual mills, cylindrical grinders, surface grinders, and drill presses.
  • Lathe skills: Setup tools, tool offsets, work offsets, hand edit code, prove program and run.
  • Milling skills: Conventional, 2 axis CNC bridgeport, 3 axis verticals, and 4th axis knowledge. Must be able to setup tools, tools offsets, work offsets, hand edit code, prove programs and run.
  • Ability to read, understand, and diagnose CNC programs as well as follow proven work instructions.
  • Ability to use QA tools to verify dimensions and tolerances. Ex: Micrometers, calipers, bore gauges, trimics, height gauges, etc...
  • Ability to read and understand dimensional tolerances and geometric tolerances from blueprints.
  • Regularly performs milling, turning, drilling, tapping, de-burring, sawing and sanding tasks.
  • Assists in other work areas to perform welding, and some fabrications.
  • Ability to follow verbal and written instructions and follow up with clarifying questions.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

Job Requirements:

  • 3 years minimum on the job machining experience,
  • Must be fluent in setup, problem solving, G&M coding, and manual machining.
  • Must be willing to work evenings and weekends and overtime when needed.
  • Must be punctual and reliable
  • Strong technical and math skills.
  • Ability to read and understand most G&M — CNC codes
  • Ability to diagnose and correct dimensional errors in machine programming
  • Ability to read, understand, and diagnose CNC programs
  • Must be able to hold tolerances of .0005 - .001
  • Ability to read and understand dimensional tolerances and geometric tolerances from blueprints.
  • Ability to follow verbal and written instructions.

Pay:

$16-$22/hr.

Benefits include:

  • Paid Employee Health
  • Paid Vacation
  • Paid Holidays
  • 401k retirement w/ company contributions
  • Tool credit account
  • Quarterly bonus program

item.title: Assistant Manager
item.description:
Job Description

 

Job Title:       Assistant Recruiter

Reports to:   Major Accounts Mananger

Supervises:  [all temporary associates]

Status:           exempt

 

 

Job Summary:

As a staffing specialist, responsibilities include sourcing, evaluating, engaging, and managing candidates through the recruiting life cycle. Additionally, the position is responsible for managing relationships with clients, including candidate presentation, order taking, and order management.

Essential Functions:

  • Acts as the primary liaison between AtWork and the Customer.  Responsible for growing relationships and creating new opportunities with assigned accounts.  
  • Communicates with customers by phone or in person and receives orders, enters and maintains data and all pertinent activity in Avionte for applicants, orders, and clients.
  • Oversees and responds to concerns regarding the employee’s performance for the customer including counseling, disciplining, termination and removal from the job assignment. 
  • Independently follows up with clients with a high sense of urgency to deliver bad/good news. 
  • Self-sufficiently resolves customer complaints in an effective manner.
  • Identifies and works to resolve customer/applicant related issues with a high sense of urgency, while consistently looking for opportunities to improve the customer experience.
  • Manage and communicate job postings
  • Schedule and conduct phone and face to face interviews.
  • Interview effectively so as to understand the technical depths of each and every candidate you meet.
  • Work with our customer facing Account Executives to understand client needs and requirements, take those requirements and identify and match them with appropriate candidates.
  • Be honest and respectful of anyone and everyone you interact with.
  • follow up with the professionals you’re working with as well as those who are on projects at our clients.
  • Participate in training including product, software and sales training.

item.title: Warehouse Associate
item.description:
AtWork Personnel in Irondale, AL is currently looking for energetic, motivated, and detail oriented individuals to join our team.

 

*PLEASE CLICK THE LINK BELOW TO COMPLETE APPLICATION*

www.atwork.com/irondale

-CREATE LOGIN AND PASSWORD

-SELECT IRONDALE, AL FOR LOCATION

 

Position Summary

 

This entry- level Warehouse position contributes to the effectiveness of the Company in the maintenance of the warehouse and inventory, as well as shipping and customer service functions for the Division.

 

Essential Duties

 

  1. Assists with deliveries, receiving and order selection; includes maintaining warehouse in logical order to support operations via the P21 system and the receipt, storage and shipping of warehouse inventory utilizing RF guns and P21 system for all transactions.
  2. Delivers orders when needed including local and long haul deliveries.
  3. Assists the customers as needed with Will Call Orders and pulls customer orders for pickup and delivery.
  4. Processes daily paperwork in an accurate and timely manner.

 

Other Duties

 

  1. Assists in annual inventory of product.
  2. Assists Customer Service and Inside Sales in the office when needed.
  3. Other Duties as assigned by Distribution Manager.

Physical Demands

These physical demands are representative of the physical requirements necessary for an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations can be made to enable people with disabilities to perform the described essential functions of this position.

Position requires standing for extended periods of time and includes reaching by extending hand(s) and arm(s) in any direction.  Some finger dexterity required to manipulate objects with as well as extensive use of whole hand(s), or arm(s).  Ability to see at close range and distinguish colors.  Extensive pulling, reaching overhead, pushing and stooping.  Must be able to lift a minimum of 25 lbs.

 

 

Work Environment

While performing the responsibilities of this position, these work environment characteristics are representative of the environment the employee will encounter. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable people with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is often exposed to moving mechanical parts and vehicles. The noise level in the work environment is moderate to loud.  There is some exposure to dust and other air particles requiring the use of proper PPE equipment.  Stress levels based on work pace vary from moderate to periods of high stress.
