item.title: Coating/Compression Operator
item.description:
Currently searching for Coating Operators to work for a Pharmaceutical company located in Doral, FL. This is a Temp-to Hire position. 

  • Weekly, direct deposit
  • 3rd Shift (10pm to 6:30am)

Responsibilities and Duties

• Perform manufacturing tasks as assigned in the manufacturing department with proficiency in all aspects of tablet coating.

• Operate and clean manufacturing coating room and equipment.

• Operate and clean all coating and solution preparation equipment used in the film coating operation.

• Set up coating equipment and calibrate spray guns.

• Transport core tablets from staging area to coating room. Verify all core tablet containers for accuracy and quantities received.

• Operate tablet coating machines as per product batch record following Standard Operating Procedures.

• Calculate tablet weight gain and document all in process quality checks.

• Load the tablet coater with tablet cores.

• Set up the coaters Compu-Coat system according to the validated coating parameters.

• Monitor validated coating parameters make adjustment as needed.

• Un-load coated tablets into container for weight out.

• Calculate and document USP water and colorant weight in the batch record.

• Transport solution to coating room.

• Document all process readings in the manufacturing batch record.

• Perform changeover and set-up of designated manufacturing equipment.

• Practice Good Manufacturing procedure as trained in cGMP training.

• Required to wear appropriate safety equipment and adhere to safety procedures and Federal and State regulations. • Monitor coating machine operation periodically and report any abnormal conditions to the immediate Supervisor.

• Assist manufacturing supervisor in the collection of information to conduct investigations.

• Follow procedures described in SOP’s and report deviations to the immediate supervisor.

• Facilitate and cooperate with any Continuous Improvement Program.

• Perform other duties as assigned by supervisor

Qualifications and Skills

• High School diploma or equivalent.

• 5-7 years experience as solid dose Manufacturing Operator.

• Demonstrated proficiency in the English Language, both written and oral.

• Proficiency in basic math.

• Ability to lift routinely 30-60 lbs.

• Exposure to vitamins, mineral, herbal, and OTC products disagreeable odors, high-noise levels, continuous standing. No allergies.

• Adhere to pre-established manufacturing schedule

 

Salary: $13.75

item.title: Equipment Mechanic
item.description:
We are looking for an Equipment Mechanic for a Pharmaceutical company located in Doral. This is a TEMP position to work 3rd shift from 10pm to 6:30am, Monday to Friday.

 

 JOB QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Vocational/Technical credits and or diploma
  • 3-5 years experience in the following areas; electrical, mechanical, pneumatic, troubleshooting of dry dose manufacturing equipment
  • Good communication skills
  • Must have good general knowledge of dry dose pharmaceutical equipment
  • Ability to work with hand and power tools
  • Ability to start, stop and operate all equipment
  • Ability to work on ladders, scaffolds and in pits
  • Performs work with minimum supervision

 

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Install, modify, troubleshoot and repair manufacturing equipment.
  • Service and maintain tablet presses, capsule fillers, spray coating systems, bin blenders, vacuum transfer systems, and other dry dose manufacturing equipment.
  • Conduct preventative and corrective maintenance on machines, equipment and others, as assigned.
  • Install, modify, and adjust mechanical, pneumatic, hydraulic, electronic and electrical systems in manufacturing equipment.
  • Work with electrical, mechanical drawings, verbal instructions and/or sketches.
  • Perform diagnostics and repairs on complex equipment when failure occurs.
  • Occasionally performs work in other trades as company requirements.
  • Assists other mechanics and outside vendors/contractors when needed.

 

JOB DESCRIPTION

 

  • Perform work in mechanic’s skill area such as fabrication, assembly, cutting, drilling, plumbing and pipefitting.
  • Clean debris and lubricant from parts, work area and equipment.
  • Complete all required paperwork as good documentation practices.
  • Follow GMP and SOP regulation when performing PM’s, tasks or jobs on equipment.
  • Follow all applicable safety and environmental regulations.
  • Perform other duties as assigned or required by business needs

 

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

  • Ability to manually lift 50 pounds intermittently

item.description:

item.title: Forklift Driver
item.description:
Must have Shipping/Receiving Hilo experience.

Forklift Operators will be required to use standard diesel of propane powered forklifts or telescopic forklifts primarily assigned to unload materials and supplies necessary for the plant operation; move palletized bagged materials from a conveyor line to the storage yard; load both flatbed and box trucks for shipping using either portable loading ramps or operating off the ground.

  • Work safely and responsibly and follow all safety policies and procedures
  • Perform daily equipment checks and minor service maintenance
  • Moving palletized materials throughout the storage facility
  • Installs and re-supplies as necessary rolls of bagging film, rolls of stretch wrap, top sheet, pallets, bottom sheet, labels, and other consumables as needed.
  • Follow shipping instructions and load trucks with proper materials to complete orders
  • Move & stack pallets in the correct storage areas
  • Lift and carry boards between pallets while stacking
  • Align pallet stacks vertically and safely
  • Ensure bags are not damaged during pallet handling
  • Examine bag products to verify conformance to quality standards
  • Perform work according to accepted procedures and practices
  • Change out propane tanks or fill with diesel fuel depending on the type of forklift
  • Keep accurate records of production data
  • Communicate all concerns affecting safety, quality, productivity and the work environment to the Supervisor
  • Other work as required and assigned

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Must have forklift experience
  • High degree of attention required to prevent injury to self and coworkers; promote a safe workplace
  • Must be able to wear steel-toed shoes and safety glasses
  • Must be able to speak, comprehend, and read English
  • Must be able to work safely in varying temperatures in production/warehouse workplace and outside year round
  • Must be able to lift and carry 20-25 pounds regularly
  • Must be able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds occasionally

item.title: Quality Inspector 3RD Shift
item.description:
HOURS:  3RD SHIFT TUESDAY - SATURDAY   11:00 P.M. - 7:30 A.M.

Inspects molded parts for cycle time, physical defects and critical measurements.

Perform functional leak, fit, etc., tests.

Verifies product complies with established quality standards.

Release molds that comply with quality specifications.

Rejects defective material and marks type of defect on inspection tag.

Inspects all labels for proper information and identification.

Inspects assembled parts and packaged units, verifies product complies with established quality standards.

Verifies the integrity of assembly - pull test, proper fitting - on assembled parts and the right combination of components.

Inspects packaging to ensure packaging material used, printed information, process and production record is appropriate for the application.

Implement corrective actions.

Documents all decisions made, releases, incidences, re-work, and submit to Quality Control Department.
item.job:requirements:
Must have high school diploma and or training/experience in the quality inspection field.

Familiar with various quality control procedures and related information; production processes and related equipment and testing techniques; regulatory policies.
item.job:additionalinfo: Job is located in Cleveland, TN.  Training will take place on 1st shift.  Position is a full-time, temp to hire, 3RD shift position.   Must be able to pass a background check and a drug test.  Must have good work history.

item.title: Hi-lo Drivers
item.description:
Must have Shipping/Receiving Hilo experience.

Forklift Operators will be required to use standard diesel of propane powered forklifts or telescopic forklifts primarily assigned to unload materials and supplies necessary for the plant operation; move palletized bagged materials from a conveyor line to the storage yard; load both flatbed and box trucks for shipping using either portable loading ramps or operating off the ground.

  • Work safely and responsibly and follow all safety policies and procedures
  • Perform daily equipment checks and minor service maintenance
  • Moving palletized materials throughout the storage facility
  • Installs and re-supplies as necessary rolls of bagging film, rolls of stretch wrap, top sheet, pallets, bottom sheet, labels, and other consumables as needed.
  • Follow shipping instructions and load trucks with proper materials to complete orders
  • Move & stack pallets in the correct storage areas
  • Lift and carry boards between pallets while stacking
  • Align pallet stacks vertically and safely
  • Ensure bags are not damaged during pallet handling
  • Examine bag products to verify conformance to quality standards
  • Perform work according to accepted procedures and practices
  • Change out propane tanks or fill with diesel fuel depending on the type of forklift
  • Keep accurate records of production data
  • Communicate all concerns affecting safety, quality, productivity and the work environment to the Supervisor
  • Other work as required and assigned

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Must have forklift experience
  • High degree of attention required to prevent injury to self and coworkers; promote a safe workplace
  • Must be able to wear steel-toed shoes and safety glasses
  • Must be able to speak, comprehend, and read English
  • Must be able to work safely in varying temperatures in production/warehouse workplace and outside year round
  • Must be able to lift and carry 20-25 pounds regularly
  • Must be able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds occasionally

item.job:additionalinfo:
AtWork Personnel Company Profile

For over 25 years AtWork has exceeded the needs and expectations of clients and job seekers by staying committed to our mission: To be AtWork for You. This service-focused approach has fueled our growth from 11 offices in 1992 to nearly 100 offices in 26 states, and counting.

@WORK Personnel Services is a full service staffing supplier offering a broad variety of customized employment programs to fit the precise needs of each of our valued clients and employees. Such programs include traditional temporary labor, temp-to-hire personnel, payrolling, direct hire, and complete on-site services.

@WORK Personnel Services consists of independently owned franchise offices that each have the independent freedom to custom design specific staffing solutions for clients in their area. With additional regional, corporate and on-site facilities. @WORK Personnel Services has the experience and capability to create and manage the right staffing program for today’s fast moving companies.

 

AtWork Personnel Services is an EEO Employer. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Call AtWork San Francisco today. We’re always @WORK for You!

item.title: Maintenance Supervisor 3rd Shift
item.description:
PURPOSE STATEMENT: : Responsible for the safe maintenance, repair and efficiency of operation of all equipment and areas of responsibility assigned by the Maintenance Manager. Supervises all assigned maintenance personnel and coordinates efforts to ensure all personnel are safely, effectively and correctly performing all daily maintenance activities to ensure maximum production quality and efficiency, while supporting the various policies, goals and objectives of RPC.

Job Description

  • Assigns all daily maintenance activities to assigned shift mechanics.
  • Supervises all activities of assigned maintenance mechanics to ensure all mechanics are performing routine daily activities effectively, safely, and in a timely manner.
  • Initiates, assigns and supervises all shift mechanics duties and responsibilities required to implement the Bakeries maintenance program based on best practices in the baking industry, with a strong emphasis on planning, scheduling and preventive maintenance
  • Monitors the use and inventories of all spare parts and supplies needed for the proper maintenance and emergency repair of all assigned equipment and systems. Initiates, verifies and monitors the parts ordering conducted by his assigned maintenance personnel.
  • Updates, assigns and verifies completion of all assigned equipment’s PM assignments to properly maintain the computerized maintenance management systems (Cams). Ensures accuracy of all completed assigned reports for tracking and performing PM’s, tracking spare parts consumption, maintenance performance monitoring and reporting for customer audits.
  • Communicates regularly with all assigned maintenance mechanics and production leads both individually and as a group to ensure good two way communication concerning maintenance issues on all assigned equipment or area of responsibility. And to ensure all maintenance issues are acted upon quickly and effectively.
  • Submits periodic performance reviews and reports of all assigned maintenance employees to determine competency, knowledge, skill sets and level of contribution to the department.
  • Updates and maintains all service reports, event logs, operating, service and training manuals required by the maintenance department during his assigned shift.
  • Ensures all assigned maintenance personnel are trained periodically and adhering to all policies regarding personal safety, food safety and following all operating procedures.
  • Monitors and verifies parameters and conditions which all assigned production equipment is set and allowed to run at to ensure maximum performance and reliability is maintained.
  • Reviews the operation of all assigned equipment and systems constantly, to minimize unplanned downtime, anticipate problems, plan future repairs and identify opportunities for improvement.
  • Initiates and carries out small projects assigned by the Maintenance Manager that improve efficiencies, reduce operating cost or improves equipment reliability with or without project managers assistance.
  • Adhere to all guidelines, mandates and parameters set by Maintenance Manager such as overtime utilization, parts purchasing procedures, and all department asset utilization guidelines to help satisfy budgetary constraints.
  • Maintains a safe, healthy and comfortable work environment for all maintenance employees.
  • Ensures all city, state, federal and local regulations pertaining to the maintenance personal and there activities are adhered to at all times.
  • Implements and delegates out the work order program for their assigned maintenance mechanics. Supervises, distributes, completes and reviews all work orders pertaining to their assigned equipment. Ensures all assigned wok orders are completed and returned to the originator in a timely manner.
  • Communicates directly with the production department leads to coordinate any maintenance activities that will effect production threw put or any repair that may increase the risk of having a food safety issue during assigned shift.
  • Responsible to respond, investigate and resolve all equipment related product contamination issues that occur during assigned shift quickly and permanently.
  • Communicates with the QC department to ensure that their assigned mechanics are effectively participating in, adhering to and implementing all QA policies and procedures regarding food safety while any maintenance duties are performed.
  • Communicates directly with the Sanitation department to ensure that their assigned mechanics are effectively participating in, adhering to and following sanitations procedures to ensure plant cleanliness while any maintenance duties are performed.
  • Maintains good attendance and punctuality. Follows established work schedule.
  • Maintain a positive and respectful attitude; cooperate with co-workers, management, internal and external customers, as applicable. Reports any incidents of harassment to his Supervisor or Human Resources Manager.
  • Must be able to take direction and follow instructions.
  • Must work safely at all times and report any unsafe conditions or injuries to his Supervisor or Safety Manager immediately.
  • Must be willing to comply with other duties, as assigned by upper management.

*

Supervisory Responsibilities:

  • Responsible to ensure entire assigned maintenance staff is properly supervised while performing all maintenance activities.
  • Ensure all assigned maintenance mechanics carry out their responsibilities in accordance with all the Bakeries policies and applicable laws.
  • Assist with training of all new maintenance personnel assigned to shift.
  • Directly responsible for the planning, assigning, scheduling, directing work, appraising performance, rewarding , disciplining, addressing complaints, resolving issues and imposing disciplinary action of all assigned maintenance employees.

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/EXPERIENCE:

  • Must regularly perform preventative maintenance or repairs to equipment personally in cases were alternative means of resolving issues are not present.
  • Must be available to be contacted by maintenance personnel and reasonably available to report to work in cases of emergency.
  • Must be available to represent RPC in any litigation or hearing pertaining to their duties.
  • Must be willing to work flexible hours.
  • Must be able to regularly lift and or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and or move 50 pounds.
  • Must be able to work on ladders, scissor lifts, scaffolding and other high precarious places safely and effectively.
  • Must be able to work around electrical, mechanical, hydraulic, pneumatic and thermodynamic equipment safely.

item.title: Laundry Associate
item.description:
AtWork is currently looking for full laundry associates in the Apopka, FL area. This is a great position to make some extra $$$$. Please apply today for immediate consideration.

• Meets linen production standards and operating all equipment in a safe and efficient manner, and ensuring proper settings for each type of linen.

• Keys in proper codes on the computer to ensure that all customers’ codes and goods are stored. Monitors the operation of the machines to ensure that the pre-programmed sequence for selecting the soiled linen is operating properly.

• Utilizes PPE. Dumps soiled linen onto the conveyor at a constant speed. Sorts soiled linen from different accounts into respective classifications. Looks for and removes foreign objects from linen, including OR instruments, needles, trash, etc.; places objects in designated location.

• Uses hard hat when operating manual lift. Loads small washers by hand, entering the proper code and formula to start washers. Unloads clean linen from washers into baskets, delivering baskets to proper location.

• Checks dryer display for type of load. Loads properly-sized load into dryers, setting the appropriate time, temperature, and cool-down period.

• Responds to press alarm in a timely manner, notifying Laundry Mechanic of issues with the press.

• Maintains clean and orderly work area, including floors and waste containers.

• May complete daily performance tickets and records.

• Performs other duties as assigned or directed to ensure the smooth operation of the department.

Requirements:

Experience in a laundry facility/housekeeping

Ability to work in a face paced environment.

Able to stand for long periods of time

Must be able to pass a drug screen and background check

High school diploma or equivalent

 

Current schedules:

Sunday (Morning Shifts):
4:00AM - 12:30PM
Monday - Thursday (Evening Shifts):
1:00PM - 9:30PM

OR

Friday (Morning Shifts):
4:00AM - 12:30PM
Sunday- Wednesday(Evening Shifts):
1:00PM - 9:30PM

item.description:
@Work Personnel Services is currently hiring a data entry clerk for a busy company in the Orlando, FL area. If you are looking for a full time position with a growing company apply today!

Data Entry Clerk Job Duties:

  • Processes customer and account source documents by reviewing data for deficiencies; resolving discrepancies by using standard procedures or returning incomplete documents to the team leader for resolution.

  • Secures information by completing data base backups.

  • Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

item.title: 2nd Shift Industrial Food Maintenance Mechanic
item.description:
Job Summary

2nd Shift Industrial Maintenance Technician job opportunity with fantastic, food manufacturing plant. Great benefits and incentives. Must have experience working in a Manufacturing Plant.

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/EXPERIENCE :

GENERAL KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS

  • Must be able to demonstrate mechanical ability and skills and carry out daily maintenance activities, plant rounds, preventative maintenance, plant calls and continual improvement assignments.
  • Must have general maintenance troubleshooting skills and equipment component knowledge to properly diagnose equipment failures.
  • Must understand proper lubrication practices of bearings, chains, and gearboxes.
  • Must be capable of using all shop and hand tools and equipment in a safe and proper manner
  • Must be able to perform all assigned equipment service in a professional manner and follow instructions.
  • Must be able to follow, understand and utilize work logs, breakdown reports, work orders and preventive maintenance logs.

ELECTRICAL SKILLS

  • Must meet or exceed the following electrical requirements
  • Demonstrate the ability to use a voltmeter properly to identify voltage, amperage and resistance of an electrical circuit.
  • Demonstrate the ability to read and utilize electrical schematics to diagnose electrical problems.
  • Demonstrate ability to properly electrically disconnect and reconnect DC, AC, motion control and Wye-Delta Motors.

MECHANICAL SKILLS

  • Able to distinguish and identify chain, sprockets, gearbox types and belts.
  • Able to identify shaft sizes and material of construction.
  • Able to identify and distinguish bolts and nuts sizes, applications and material of construction.
  • Able to identify basic equipment parts and components for job assignments.
  • Capable of tracking product conveyor belts
  • Perform effective preventive maintenance on equipment with minimal supervision.

WELDING

  • Demonstrate basic ability to weld metal, stick, or Heliarc.
  • Demonstrate the ability to perform basic copper soldering
  • Demonstrate the proper use of oxy/acetylene torch in cutting and brazing.

REFRIGERATION

  • Demonstrate basic refrigeration comprehension and understanding of refrigeration fundamentals, components and their functions.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS:

  • Maintains good attendance and punctuality. Follows established work schedule.
  • Must have excellent communication skills both oral and written.
  • Maintain a positive and respectful attitude; cooperate with co-workers, management, internal and external customers, as applicable. Reports any incidents of harassment to his Supervisor or Human Resources Manager.
  • Must be able to take direction and follow instructions.
  • Must work safely at all times and report any unsafe conditions or injuries to his Supervisor or Safety Manager immediately.

Must be willing to comply with other duties, assigned by direct supervisors.

MINIMUM REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS, EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE :

  • 5 years’ experience working with industrial equipment
  • High School Graduate or GED
  • Must be able to provide personnel tools to perform all assigned maintenance tasks
  • Must be willing to work flexible hours.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

item.title: Manufacturing Technician Mon-Fri OFF BY 2:30pm
item.description:
Manufacturing Technician

EMAIL RESUME TO KROBINSON@ATWORK.COM AND CALL KATIE AT 442-287-0300

OFF BY 2:30 PM!

MON-FRI

 

The primary role of a Manufacturing Technician 1 is to assist in the new build and refurbishment of various equipment and/or equipment assemblies including, but not limited to disassembly, assembly, installation, quality control, and packaging.

 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

  1. Requires mechanical ability such as assemblies of hardware, fittings, tubing, etc.
  2. Perform routine repetitive tasks to prepare process, assemble, manufacture, and inspect components and various equipment.
  3. Utilize time efficiently in order to reach daily production goals while maintaining safe working environment/practices.
  4. Provides assistance to other departments and special projects as required.
item.job:requirements:
Qualifications:

To perform this job successfully, the individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Education and/or Experience: 

Basic education is needed in terms of basic communication skills.

Previous experience in a factory or warehouse setting is preferred including, but not limited to experience using various hand tools including small machinery.

  • Hand tools could include power drills, screwdrivers, wrenches, etc.
  • Small machinery could include pallet jack, drill press, band saw, belt sander, and grinder.

Mathematical/Computer Skills:

Associates are expected to possess some math skills consisting of some addition and subtraction.  Computer skills not required.

Physical Demands: 

Associates are required to stand for long periods up to the entire work shift, which is normally 8 hours.  Common bodily movements would include lifting up to 50 lbs., reaching, squatting, and kneeling.

Work Environment:

Associates are required to work in a manufacturing environment that may contain some dust and debris depending on the type of work being done.  Additionally, some operations may require the use of safety glasses and/or hearing protection.  The working environment is one that is free of all food and beverages, including water.

Our client in Robbinsville area are looking for Janitors/Custodial Worker/Cleaner to clean assigned area and Bathrooms..

item.title: Warehouse-Picker/Packer New Brunswick
item.description:
We are seeking energetic, motivated and reliable Warehouse Workers for immediate openings on 1st Shift. You will be responsible for providing warehouse support including: picking, packing, staging, loading and unloading products of orders to meet the facility's productivity and quality demands.

Warehouse Worker - Warehouse General Labor - Laborer - Production - Shipping and Receiving – Processors – Equipment Operators, Material Handler, and Line Leaders

Job Responsibilities:

We are looking for employees with positive attitudes that can handle multiple projects simultaneously. As a Warehouse Worker, you will work in a manufacturing and production environment. Your duties will include pulling, picking, packing and sorting items for shipping and receiving.

Other Responsibilities of this role include:

  • Pick Products as instructed by voice picking technology
  • Ensures that all products are accurate and in good condition before packing
  • Checks the product description, unit of measurement and product expiration date before packing.
  • Packs product in the correct box or tote.
  • Send boxes or totes in the correct sequence to the audit area.
  • Palletizes products in the correct sequences when necessary.
  • Operates forklifts( only if properly certified) when necessary.
  • Communicates with auditor/ and or member of the shipping department to ensure that all orders are correct and sent to shipping department.
  • Cleans and maintains the warehouse.
  • Turn off equipment( such as conveyers and forklifts) when not in use.
  • Assists co-workers with daily operations.
  • Perform backup according to job assignment.
  • Make sure that products left behind on shelves are in the correct location and visible for other pickers and stockers.
  • Prepares orders for picking and affixing the correct labels to each box or tote;organizing boxes or totes in the correct sequence and in "trains" when necessary.
  • Packing materials for shipment
  • Lifting up to 50 lbs on a regular basis
  • Standing for extended periods of time
item.job:requirements:
As a Warehouse Worker, you must be able to work in a team-oriented environment.  You must be able to communicate well with management and fellow employees.  Ideal candidates will have a positive attitude and previous warehouse experience.

Other requirements include:

  • High school diploma
  • 6 month - 1 year of previous work experience in a warehouse
  • Must be willing to submit to drug screen and background checks
  • Needs to be able to work 40 plus hours per week, some overtime may be required
  • Ability to lift 50 lbs
  • Ability to provide 3 positive work references.
